Title: Associate- Data Operations
Description:
Why Work For Us

Grubhub, part of Wonder Group Inc, is all about connecting hungry diners with our network of over 375,000 merchants nationwide. Innovative technology, user-friendly platforms and streamlined delivery capabilities set us apart and make us an industry leader in the world of online food ordering. When you join our team, you become part of a community that works together to innovate, solve problems, grow, work hard and have a ton of fun in the process!




Grubhub is seeking an Associate to join our Corporate Accounts Data team. In this role, you will be instrumental in supporting our customer acquisition effort by focusing on mission critical projects including lead sourcing, data enrichment, and lead distribution. You will partner with the broader Sales and Operations team to have the best in class lead and prospect data.




This is a role that requires strong organization, internal collaboration, project management and analytical skills. You will dive deep - into data, process, and the customer experience - to identify the critical insights necessary to improve business performance and translate these into action

The ideal candidate will be a proactive problem-solver with a strong background in data management and a passion for optimizing operational processes in a fast-paced environment.




The Impact You Will Make

Support Lead database for one of Grubhub’s key business lines
Manage the lead database including sourcing and adding net new leads as well as enriching existing leads
Follow the strategy for distributing leads to the sales team including owning some of the systems and processes to do so
Troubleshoot and resolve data-related issues in a timely manner, minimizing impact on business operations
Collaborate with marketing and sales teams to support lead generation and enrichment initiatives
Prepare regular reports on data quality metrics and operational performance for senior leadership




What You Bring to the Table

2+ years of experience in a data-focused role, ideally supporting a sales team
Analytical mindset and fluency with numbers
Advanced SQL and Google Sheets skills such as pivot tables and lookups
Experience with data visualization and dashboarding tools such as Tableau, Sigma
Familiarity with Salesforce a plus
Comfortable in ambiguous environments while maintaining a strong bias for action
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain complex data concepts to non-technical stakeholders




Base Salary:

Chicago: $67,500- 74,000




Wonder Group uses geographic-specific salary structures, which means the salary offered may vary depending on where the job is located. The final salary offer will take into account various factors, such as the candidate's skills, education, training, credentials, and experience.




And Of Course, Perks!

PTO. Grubhub employees enjoy a generous amount of time to recharge.
Health and Wellness. Excellent medical, dental and vision benefits, employee network groups and paid parental leave are just a few of our programs to support your overall well-being.
Free Meals. Our employees get a weekly Grubhub credit to enjoy.
Social Impact. At Grubhub we believe in giving back through programs like the Grubhub Community Fund. Employees are also given paid time off each year to support the causes that are important to them.

Title: Data Insights Analyst (Remote)
Description:
Employer Industry: Healthcare Data Analytics

Why Consider This Job Opportunity


Competitive pay structure with opportunities for advancement
Supportive and progressive work environment that thrives on innovation
Matching 401(k) with immediate vesting
Comprehensive medical, dental, vision, life, and short-term disability insurance
Opportunity to work with cutting-edge tools like Salesforce and Tableau
Chance to make a significant impact on data quality and client satisfaction


What To Expect (Job Responsibilities)


Acquire, manage, and analyze data for internal teams, clients, and partners
Develop reports and analytics using data from the data warehouse and Salesforce
Communicate directly with clients regarding data needs and deadlines
Review and ensure the quality of data/reports before delivery to clients
Lead web-based training sessions for clients/partners on data specifications


What Is Required (Qualifications)


Proficient in Microsoft Excel and SQL
Previous client-facing experience is a must
Must be a self-starter with the ability to work independently
Experience with Tableau and Salesforce reporting preferred
Strong ability to thrive in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial-like environment


How To Stand Out (Preferred Qualifications)


Experience with healthcare and/or pharmacy data
Exceptional responsiveness and ability to work under pressure in crisis situations
Familiarity with data quality issues and solutions

Title: Clinical Informatics Assistant - Full Time
Description:
Description

Essential Functions:

Provides daily support to staff to Physicians and clinical staff for Athena/IDX schedules.

Trains staff on policies, procedures and clinic protocols.

Acts as a liaison between office staff/physicians, and management.

Assist Analysts and Director with any projects they are working within the scope of responsibility.

Assists with system testing to include all applicable systems as instructed by following the testing plan and assigned areas.

Attends support staff and other assigned meetings.

Demonstrates competent computer skills.

Requirements

Required Education and Experience:

High school graduate or equivalent required. One-year data entry and customer service experience, knowledge of medical terminology. Experience with an EMR or Practice Management system is preferred.

Description:
Employer Industry: Remote Work Opportunities

Why Consider This Job Opportunity


Flexible work schedule, allowing you to choose part-time or full-time hours from anywhere
Comprehensive training provided to ensure your success, even if you have no prior experience
Opportunity to participate in various research studies, contributing to meaningful outcomes
Ideal for individuals looking to supplement their existing job or work from home
No degree required, making it accessible for a wide range of backgrounds
Perfect for stay-at-home parents, retirees, and those seeking to learn how to generate income online


What To Expect (Job Responsibilities)


Participate in research studies that contribute to valuable outcomes
Work remotely, enjoying the flexibility of your own schedule
Utilize your computer and internet access to complete tasks
Follow oral and written instructions to ensure accuracy in data entry
Engage in an accommodating work environment that supports your career growth


What Is Required (Qualifications)


Computer with internet access and a stable connection
Quiet workspace away from distractions
Ability to work independently without immediate supervision
Capacity to read, understand, and follow instructions
Familiarity with data entry or administrative tasks is a bonus, but not necessary


How To Stand Out (Preferred Qualifications)


Background in healthcare, customer service, warehouse, or delivery roles
Experience in data entry or administrative assistance, although not required


#RemoteWork #FlexibleSchedule #DataEntry #CareerOpportunities #NoExperienceNeeded

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Description

Weaver Fundraising is the industry leader providing superior technology and service in product fundraising for over 44 years. The Sr. Business Intelligence Analyst will join the Business Intelligence team in an important role that delivers impactful analytics that benefit both internal teams and business outcomes. To capture the right business insights, the job requires expertise in reporting and analytics, digital marketing analytics, data analysis, and proficiency in SQL, Excel and visualization tools. Your role will be essential in shaping the company's data-driven fundraising location program and contributing to its continued growth and success. Come grow with us!

Location: Indianapolis, IN (hybrid)

HOW WILL YOU HELP US GROW?


Work to connect organizational data from multiple warehouses/sets
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand and deliver on reporting requirements
Build and maintain robust data models to ensure data accuracy and availability
Identify opportunities for process improvement and automation to streamline data workflows and reporting processes
Conduct regular data quality checks and implement measures to maintain data integrity and alert stakeholders to anomalies
Work closely with the BI team to optimize data architecture and ensure data accessibility.
Integrate and leverage AI/ML-driven features in business intelligence platforms (e.g., Domo, Power BI, Tableau) to enhance predictive insights and decision-making
Develop algorithms and apply AI models to predict orders, fundraising trends, and customer behaviors
Provide training and support to stakeholders on data analysis and reporting tools
Troubleshoot data integrity issues promptly, taking proactive measures to address and resolve them
Undertake other tasks, projects, and initiatives as needed


Requirements

WHAT DO YOU NEED TO HAVE?


Bachelor's and/or master's degree a focus in computer science, marketing science, math, statistics or data analysis
Minimum of 5 years of experience in SQL, database design, and data warehouse design
Familiarity with data visualization tools like Domo, Power BI or Tableau
Experience with Domo is a plus
Experience integrating AI/ML solutions into BI tools or workflows to improve analytics and forecasting
General understanding of data security
Strong cross-functional team leadership and proven track record of successfully delivering products and services
Passion for data and a genuine interest in making complex data easily understandable for various audiences.
Obsession with organization and detail
Autonomous self-starter


HOW WILL WE HELP YOU GROW?


Up to 5% 401K company match
$2500 annual HSA contribution
Up to $15K in continued ed reimbursement
Healthy snacks
Free headquarters gym access
Collaborative, positive and energetic team environment!


The role responsibilities are many, various, and not limited to those written in this document.
Show more

Title: Repository Technician
Description:
Ready to shape the future of science and global health? ATCC, a leading nonprofit biological resources and standards organization, is seeking a Repository Technician to work onsite in Frederick, MD.

The Repository Technician supports warehouse tasks involving inventory management, storage, retrieval, and shipping of biological materials for commercial and government clients. This role will expose you to the biorepository industry standards. Shipping, inventory, and warehouse experience would make you a great candidate for this job!

Join ATCC and be part of a team that supports the global scientific community with trusted, authenticated biological materials.

Responsibilities


Laboratory and Material Handling: Monitor and maintain temperature-controlled storage systems, ensure inventory organization, and wear proper PPE (personal protective equipment) while obtaining biomaterials from repository freezers.
Operations Coordination: Processing incoming shipments, stock replenishment and inventory, and preparing samples for shipment.
Organization and Documentation: Manage inventory and maintain biological materials in proper cold chain environment (196°C (-321°F) degrees to 29°C (85°F) degrees) through the monitoring of storage systems, freezers and tanks. Performing functions following standard operating procedures, systematic data entry, and performing good documentation practices (GDP) and maintaining cGMP standards.



Qualifications


High School diploma or equivalent experience with 2-5 years of relevant experience
Warehouse, shipping/handling, or inventory experience required
Attention to detail for batch number and item number differentiation and counting
Willingness and ability to learn inventory management systems
Ability to learn and follow quality control/assurance procedures
Effective communication in English (both verbal and written), strong organizational skills
Staff hired for the NCI Central Repository Program must be eligible to obtain an NIH Personal Identity Verification (PIV) Card by submitting a Declaration of Federal Employment form within 60 days (about 2 months) of employment.
See links below for eligibility which includes obtaining a Public Trust Clearance and a background investigation.



 

1443 - Homeland Security Presidential Directive 12 (HSPD-12) Implementation Policy (nih.gov)

 

Declaration for Federal Employment, Optional Form 306 (opm.gov)

Benefits

The expected salary range for this position is $40,000 to $50,000 annually. Actual compensation will be determined based on experience and qualifications as well as internal equity and alignment with market data. In addition to base salary, this role may be eligible for additional incentive compensation including regular merit increases and the corporate bonus program.

We Invest in You


Health & Wellness:
Comprehensive medical coverage and company paid Life Insurance, Disability Insurance & AD&D
Work life balance with Paid Holidays and PTO
Fitness and cell phone subsidies, and additional benefits such as Aflac, legal services, and pet insurance
Employee Assistance Program offering around-the-clock counseling
Financial security:
401(a) (6% employer contribution) and 403(b) (2% match) retirement plans
Exceptional career advancement opportunities, recognition, and rewards
Corporate bonus program
Mission Focused:
Non-profit organization supporting critical life science research
We give scientists the tools they need to make discoveries that improve and save lives
Contribute to community involvement and social responsibility

Join ATCC, where we fuel your success, well-being, and development. We're a mission-focused non-profit Equal Opportunity Employer, celebrating a century of supporting global public health. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. Shape the future of science with us.
Show more

Title: LPC (Virtual)
Description:
LPC (Virtual) at Headway summary:

A Licensed Professional Counselor (LPC) with a Master's degree or higher provides mental health counseling through private practice, facilitated by Headway's platform to accept insurance and increase access to care. The role involves managing a compliant, insurance-credentialed practice with built-in EHR features and continuing education support. This position aims to expand access to mental health services while improving provider earnings and practice management efficiency.

"

Licensed Professional Counselor (LPC)

Wage: Between $120-$131 an hour

Licensed Professional Counselor — Are you ready to launch or expand your private practice? Headway is here to help you start accepting insurance with ease, increase your earnings with higher rates, and start taking covered clients sooner. It’s all on one free-to-use platform, no commitment required.

About You


You’re a fully-licensed Professional Counselor at a Master’s level or above with LPC, LPCC, LCPC, LCPCS, LPCC-S licensure (accepted on a state by state basis), a valid NPI number, and malpractice insurance.
You’re ready to launch a private practice, or grow your existing business by taking insurance.


About Headway

Your expertise changes lives. Taking insurance makes it accessible to those who need it most. Every mental health provider who goes in-network with Headway supports people who’d otherwise be forced to choose between paying out of pocket, or not getting care at all. We make that process seamless — empowering you to accept insurance with ease, so you can do what you do best. So far, we’ve helped over 50,000 providers grow their practices, reaching countless people in need.

How Headway Supports Providers


Start taking insurance, stress-free: Get credentialed for free in multiple states in as little as 30 days and start seeing covered clients sooner.
Built-in compliance : Stay compliant from day one with audit support and ongoing resources.
Expansive coverage: Work with the plans that most clients use, including Medicare Advantage and Medicaid.
Increase your earnings: Secure higher rates with top insurance plans through access to our nationwide insurance network.
Dependable payments: Build stability in your practice with predictable bi-weekly payments you can count on.
Built-in EHR features : Manage your practice in one place with real-time scheduling, secure client messaging, end-to-end documentation templates, built-in assessments, and more.
Free continuing education : Nurture your long-term professional goals and earn CEUs with complimentary courses on Headway Academy.


How Headway Supports Your Clients


Increased access: Headway makes it easier for your clients to get the care they need at a price they can afford through insurance.
Instant verification: Clients can easily check their insurance status and get the care they need without disruption.


Please note: At this time, Headway can’t support mental health professionals that aren’t fully licensed. If your application was rejected for incomplete licensure, you’re welcome to reapply once you have a valid license.

"

Keywords:

Licensed Professional Counselor, mental health counseling, private practice, insurance credentialing, EHR management, continuing education, patient care accessibility, insurance billing, compliance support, telehealth

Increased access: Headway makes it easier for your clients to get the care they need at a price they can afford through insurance.
Instant verification: Clients can easily check their insurance status and get the care they need without disruption.


Please note: At this time, Headway can’t support mental health professionals that aren’t fully licensed. If your application was rejected for incomplete licensure, you’re welcome to reapply once you have a valid license.

"
Show more
HTML:
"

Licensed Professional Counselor (LPC)

Wage: Between $120-$131 an hour

Licensed Professional Counselor — Are you ready to launch or expand your private practice? Headway is here to help you start accepting insurance with ease, increase your earnings with higher rates, and start taking covered clients sooner. It’s all on one free-to-use platform, no commitment required.

About You

  • You’re a fully-licensed Professional Counselor at a Master’s level or above with LPC, LPCC, LCPC, LCPCS, LPCC-S licensure (accepted on a state by state basis), a valid NPI number, and malpractice insurance.
  • You’re ready to launch a private practice, or grow your existing business by taking insurance.

About Headway

Your expertise changes lives. Taking insurance makes it accessible to those who need it most. Every mental health provider who goes in-network with Headway supports people who’d otherwise be forced to choose between paying out of pocket, or not getting care at all. We make that process seamless — empowering you to accept insurance with ease, so you can do what you do best. So far, we’ve helped over 50,000 providers grow their practices, reaching countless people in need.

How Headway Supports Providers

  • Start taking insurance, stress-free: Get credentialed for free in multiple states in as little as 30 days and start seeing covered clients sooner.
  • Built-in compliance : Stay compliant from day one with audit support and ongoing resources.
  • Expansive coverage: Work with the plans that most clients use, including Medicare Advantage and Medicaid.
  • Increase your earnings: Secure higher rates with top insurance plans through access to our nationwide insurance network.
  • Dependable payments: Build stability in your practice with predictable bi-weekly payments you can count on.
  • Built-in EHR features : Manage your practice in one place with real-time scheduling, secure client messaging, end-to-end documentation templates, built-in assessments, and more.
  • Free continuing education : Nurture your long-term professional goals and earn CEUs with complimentary courses on Headway Academy.

How Headway Supports Your Clients

  • Increased access: Headway makes it easier for your clients to get the care they need at a price they can afford through insurance.
  • Instant verification: Clients can easily check their insurance status and get the care they need without disruption.

Please note: At this time, Headway can’t support mental health professionals that aren’t fully licensed. If your application was rejected for incomplete licensure, you’re welcome to reapply once you have a valid license.

"

Title: Executive Assistant
Description:
Our mission is to make exceptional healthcare accessible anytime, anywhere, for everyone.

Assort is led by Jon (Founder of Shimmer, former UCSF med student, AI researcher at Stanford) and Jeff (ex-Facebook, first engineer at Cameo, former Head of Product Engineering at Athelas/Commure).

In 2023, we became the first agentic AI to answer patient calls. Since then, we've powered tens of millions of patient interactions, helping health organizations and patients provide better access to care. We're growing fast with millions in ARR every month.

We're well-funded and backed by Quiet Capital, First Round, Chemistry, and strategic angels from Flatiron, Athena Health, Mercury, and PathAI. More funding news coming soon :).

Join us to build Assort OS - a customizable fleet of genAI agents transforming patient-provider interactions.

About The Role

We are seeking an Executive Assistant to partner directly with our co-CEO, Jon. This role is central to driving focus, alignment, and execution across the executive office. The Executive Assistant will act as a strategic partner and operational leader, ensuring the CEO's time and priorities are maximized while supporting company-wide initiatives.

What You'll Do


Manage and organize the CEO's inbox to streamline communication and ensure timely responses.
Support executive prioritization by filtering requests, surfacing critical issues, and aligning on decisions.
Oversee calendar management, ensuring effective use of time and smooth scheduling and rescheduling of internal and external meetings.
Prepare materials, agendas, and briefing documents to enable productive meetings.
Serve as board liaison, including coordinating board communications, preparing materials, and supporting follow-ups.
Coordinate light travel logistics, including itineraries and accommodations.
Drive execution of special projects and cross-functional initiatives with clear timelines and accountability.
Support people operations, including team engagement, onboarding, and HRBP-related initiatives.
Manage vendor relationships, consolidating services and negotiating pricing to optimize value.
Maintain organized documentation and file systems to ensure accessibility and alignment across teams.


What You'll Bring


Proven experience supporting executives in fast-paced, dynamic environments.
Strong organizational skills with a track record of managing competing priorities.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
High level of discretion and judgment in handling sensitive information.
Proactive problem solver with strong attention to detail.
In office five days per week : 8 am - 6 pm, with the ability to stay later as needed


Nice to haves


Experience at an early-stage company or high-growth startup.
Familiarity with CRM tools such as Salesforce, HubSpot, or similar platforms.
Project management certifications


Benefits & Perks for Assorties


Competitive Compensation - Including salary and employee stock options so you share in our success.
Lifelong Learning - Annual budget for professional development, plus training opportunities to help you grow.
Office Setup Stipend - We'll outfit your in-office workspace so comfy as it's productive.
Top-Tier Health Coverage - Medical, dental, and vision insurance, because your health comes first.
Unlimited PTO - We trust you to take the time you need to recharge and come back ready to crush it.
Show more

Title: Insights Analyst
Description:
Company Description

LinkedIn is the world’s largest professional network, built to create economic opportunity for every member of the global workforce. Our products help people make powerful connections, discover exciting opportunities, build necessary skills, and gain valuable insights every day. We’re also committed to providing transformational opportunities for our own employees by investing in their growth. We aspire to create a culture that’s built on trust, care, inclusion, and fun – where everyone can succeed.

Join us to transform the way the world works.

Job Description

At LinkedIn, our approach to flexible work is centered on trust and optimized for culture, connection, clarity, and the evolving needs of our business. The work location of this role is hybrid, meaning it will be performed both from home and from a LinkedIn office on select days, as determined by the business needs of the team.

As an Insights Analyst, you will leverage one of the richest proprietary data sets in the world to discover insights that help our field sales team serve our largest clients within our Sales Solutions business.

You’ll work closely with our sales team to deliver data-driven stories to drive customer value. This role requires the ability to make the complex simple by confidently articulating insights to non-technical audiences. You will be a strong partner, building trust through effective identification and communication of priorities and proactively seeking out and integrating feedback. You will provide consultative advice to LinkedIn's sales reps, identify solutions that improve efficiency and drive change management to expand the value we deliver to our customers (internally and externally).You will become an expert at using SQL to extract data from LinkedIn’s massive data warehouse and turning that data into compelling stories that help our clients become more successful.

Responsibilities:


Leverage LinkedIn’s unique data to create actionable insights that ultimately drive our customers' business outcomes
Write SQL/Python queries to extract necessary data and utilize Tableau, Excel and PowerPoint to analyze the results and create data driven narratives
Present the relevant business insights to partners and clients, communicating in a way that is the best fit for the audience
Approach work in an organized and systematic manner to effectively manage the delivery of assignments from partners and Insights Leaderships based on the potential impact
Develop deep knowledge and understanding of the industry talent trends and objectives of our customers. Use that knowledge to formulate effective insights
Maintain a growth mindset as we develop and grow as a team



Qualifications

Basic Qualifications


Bachelor's degree in business, operations, analytics, or related field, or equivalent experience
3+ years of experience in any of the follow: a role requiring data analysis, customer success, sales or consulting
2+ years of experience writing and querying SQL



Preferred Qualifications:


Experience with Git, Tableau/Power BI and Python
Master in managing time and prioritizing tasks independently
Experience working cross-functionally with sales teams
Experience with storytelling using data and project management
Excellent interpersonal, communication and presentation skills



Suggested Skills:


Analytics
SQL
Data Storytelling



Additional Information

Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates

Please follow this link to access the document that provides transparency around the way in which LinkedIn handles personal data of employees and job applicants: https://legal.linkedin.com/candidate-portal.

Title: Data Analyst Confirmé H/F
Description:
📋 Contexte de la mission :  

Sur les marchés Lillois, nous sommes incontournables sur le secteur retail, public, bancaire, de la protection sociale, des mutuelles, des télécoms, du service et de l’énergie. Open Nord compte actuellement 450 collaborateurs.  

 

Nous travaillons en direct chez nos clients Grands Comptes, dans leurs locaux, au sein de notre centre de services, en télétravail hybride.  

 

Nous les accompagnons de bout en bout sur leurs projets applicatifs et infrastructures : en passant par le Pilotage de projet, l’assistance à Maitrise d’Œuvre et à Maitrise d’Ouvrage, le Test, l’expertise Cloud, le DevOps et la Data...  

🎯 Venez renforcer nos équipes !   

Afin d’accompagner nos clients finaux et de renforcer nos équipes dans le cadre de projets à forte valeur ajoutée sur nos activités, nous recherchons pour notre agence Lilloise un Data Analyst H/F.

📍 Ce qui vous attend : 

Intégré à l’une de nos équipes, vous participerez aux différentes phases d’analyse et de traitement de la donnée. Vos principales missions permettront de collecter, organiser et exploiter les données stratégiques du client afin de mettre à sa disposition des informations et des outils fiables pour l’aider à prendre des décisions pertinentes.

Dans ce cadre, vos principales activités s’articuleront autour de :


L’analyse et la compréhension des enjeux et besoins métiers et techniques
La localisation et la compréhension des données de production, des processus de mise à jour et des règles de gestion des données
La définition de l'architecture et l’identification des spécifications techniques du système cible en tenant compte de l'ensemble des contraintes
Le développement de l'ensemble des processus d'intégration : préparation, extraction, transformation, chargement
La modélisation et l’enrichissement des DataLakes, DataWarehouses et DataMarts dédiés à une fonction particulière dans l'entreprise
La mise en œuvre des outils d'analyse et tableaux de bords associés permettant une exploitation de données collectées en réponse aux besoins clients


Stack Technique : Python, PowerBI, SQL, Cloud (GCP, Azure, AWS), Looker, Tableau

🌟 Vous êtes fait(e) pour ce poste si : 


Vous possédez une expérience solide dans la Data Analyse et êtes à l’aise avec la chaine de traitement de données.
Vous maitrisez l'anglais et souhaitez travailler en contexte international.
Vous faites de la veille technologique autour de la Data, du DevOps et du Cloud et vous souhaitez monter en compétences sur ces sujets.


🤝 Au-delà de la mission vous pourrez : 


Intégrer des communautés d’experts à travers nos Practices Technologiques (Cloud, Data, Modern Digital Workplace, DevOps) et Métiers (AMOA, Test et Agilité). Ces communautés permettent à chacun de monter en compétences sur des technologies émergentes par le biais de formations, de certifications, d’ateliers techniques, de projets mais aussi d’événements et de meetups. 
Bénéficier d’un suivi de proximité et personnalisé, managé(e) par un de vos pairs, d’actions de formations concrètes et d’un cadre professionnel stimulant, collaboratif et ouvert sur l'avenir.
Contribuer à augmenter l’impact positif de nos actions : faites de vos compétences des dons à destination d’associations, participez à des événements sportifs associatifs


Ce projet vous intéresse et vous pensez avoir les compétences techniques et humaines pour le mener à bien ? Venez nous rencontrer ! 

💬 Notre process de recrutement : un bref échange téléphonique, une première rencontre RH pour parler de vous, de vos aspirations professionnelles et vous présenter Open, un deuxième échange avec un interlocuteur de l’équipe managériale et un dernier temps de partage avec un de nos experts. Après vous avoir souhaité la bienvenue vous bénéficiez d’un parcours d’intégration sur-mesure ! 😊

Envie de vous projeter ? Découvrez notre vidéo immersive et imaginez-vous évoluer dans nos locaux avant même d'y mettre les pieds : Bienvenue à Lille ! #AllezViensOnEstBien »

Code Rec = MST20677



Qu’attendez-vous pour être Open ?

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Experian is a global data and technology company, powering opportunities for people and businesses around the world. We help to redefine lending practices, uncover and prevent fraud, simplify healthcare, create marketing solutions, and gain deeper insights into the automotive market, all using our unique combination of data, analytics and software. We also assist millions of people to accomplish their financial goals and help them save time and money.

We operate across a range of markets, from financial services to healthcare, automotive, agribusiness, insurance, and many more industry segments.

We invest in people and new advanced technologies to unlock the power of data. As a FTSE 100 Index company listed on the London Stock Exchange (EXPN), we have a team of 22,500 people across 32 countries. Our corporate headquarters are in Dublin, Ireland. Learn more at experianplc.com.

Job Description

Reporting into an Analytics Manager within the Product Development team you will focus on data analyses. Working with your team, you will blend a knowledge of mathematical, analytical and spatial techniques with a natural curiosity for understanding and resolving problems using data.

This is a role for someone with a numerical or data analysis background to play an important part in an exciting area of the Experian business!

What you'll do?


You will deliver analytical projects which will involve analysing data sets, getting to the bottom of what is going on with the data.
Knowledge of the digital landscape (e.g. Building audiences and delivering insights)
Support shaping and refinement of projects.
Provide mentoring to Analysts in the team.
Ensure knowledge transfer of analysis (interpretation; justification; methods).
Be an escalation point for analysts to support their work.
Ensure all work is process checked and sense checked following team checking guidelines.


Qualifications

What you'll bring:


Experienced user of at least one analytical program, such as R, Python and SAS/WPS or equivalent.
Experience using Java, Scala, R or Python within Apache Spark.
Worked with distributed file systems (such as HDFS)
Proficient in the use of MS excel (can perform complex functions).
Experience interpreting analysis outputs, providing insight and making recommendations.


Additional Information

You will get:


Personal Development - career pathway for professional growth supported by learning and development programs and unlimited access to online educational training courses, learning materials and books.
Work environment - excellent work conditions with friendly environment, recognized strong team spirit, and fun and quality recreation time.
Social benefit package including life insurance, food vouchers, additional health insurance, monthly flex allowance and internet coverage, corporate discounts, marriage and childbirth / adoption allowance, Multisport card, Sharesave plan, Employee assistance program, а birthday gift and many other benefits!
Work-life balance - 25 days paid vacation, 1 additional day off for your birthday and extra 3 paid days for participation in Social responsibility event.
Opportunity for Flexible working hours and Home Office.


Experian is an Equal opportunity employer. Everyone can succeed at Experian and bring their whole self to work, irrespective of their gender, ethnicity, religion, colour, sexuality, physical ability or age. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know at the earliest opportunity.

This is a hybrid remote/in-office role.

Experian Careers - Creating a better tomorrow together

Find out what its like to work for Experian by clicking here

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Analytics & BI
Description:
Job Description

WHAT YOU’LL DO

As a Senior Data Analyst within the Analytics & BI team at H&M Group, you will play a key role in shaping the future of our Commercial Development & Growth function. You will work closely with stakeholders across the organization to drive strategic initiatives and address the most important topics on our agenda.

To shine in this role you will…


Work with a wide range of stakeholders within Commercial Development & Growth to understand their analytical needs
Lead and execute end-to-end analytical projects focused on areas such as retail strategy, store and online growth, customer behaviour and store planning
Translate complex business questions into structured analysis plans, leveraging large internal and external datasets to deliver clear, data-driven recommendations to senior stakeholders.
Perform ad-hoc analyses to quickly address urgent business questions and support fast decision making
Contribute to the development of best practices, analytical frameworks, and ways of working within the Analytics & BI team



Who You’ll Work With

Commercial Development & Growth is a global function within the H&M brand and our mission is to set and deliver on the global customer experience strategy to strengthen our brand and enable profitable sales. Together we develop, expand and optimize all sales channels while securing conditions for efficient operations leveraged by tech and strong collaboration across the organization.

Our function plays a key role in delivering on our brand plan through an elevated, inspirational, and relevant shopping experience that is centered around our product and provides competitive convenience for our customers.

Who You Are

We are looking for people with…


A degree in a quantitative field such as engineering, business, economics, finance, or statistics.
At least 5 years of experience in data, insight, or business analyst roles, either in-house or as a consultant.
A proven ability to lead and deliver end-to-end analytical projects that drive business impact.
Experience translating complex business questions into structured analysis plans and actionable insights.
Experience from working with SQL to extract and transform data from large and complex datasets as well as using R or Python to analyse data further



And people who are…


Strong communicators who can clearly present findings and influence stakeholders at all levels.
Business-savvy and quick to interpret data in a broader commercial context.
Proactive and self-driven, with the ability to manage multiple priorities and work independently.
Collaborative team players who enjoy sharing knowledge and building capabilities across teams.
Aligned with H&M’s values, with a passion for growth, innovation, and creating customer value.



Who We Are

H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.

We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.

WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE 

At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.


All our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program (HIP)
All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound.
A dynamic, entrepreneurial environment where your insights directly influence strategic decisions.
A collaborative culture that values innovation, continuous learning, and knowledge sharing.



JOIN US

Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.

This is a full-time permanent position, starting as soon as possible according to the agreement. The role is based in our office in Stockholm, Sweden.

Apply by sending in your CV in English as soon as possible. Due to data policies, we only accept applications through our career page. The application deadline is September 11th, but please note that we will begin reviewing applications on a rolling basis.

Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here. We are eager to meet you!


We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

Title: Data Analyst, Marketing Analytics
Description:
Who we are:

Want to make an impact? Join our pack and come work (and play!) with us.




We believe everyone deserves the unconditional love of a pet—and at Rover, our mission is to make it easier to experience that love. Founded in 2011, the Rover app and website connect dog and cat parents with loving pet sitters and dog walkers in neighborhoods across the US, Canada, and Europe. We empower our community of trusted pet sitters and dog walkers to run their own pet care businesses on Rover with the tools and security of a global company to back them.




Headquartered in Seattle, Washington, we work closely with our teams in Barcelona, San Antonio, Spokane, and remote locations. We’ve got a reputation for being a great place to work, having been named among the 100 Best Companies to Work For in Seattle Business Magazine and Washington’s Best Workplaces in the Puget Sound Business Journal. We're an agile, fast-growing company, and our leadership comes from some of the world's most respected tech companies.




At Rover, our furry coworkers are just as important as our human ones—and we wouldn’t have it any other way. Along with making the joys of pet parenthood more accessible, we’re committed to fostering a diverse, inclusive, and welcoming community of pet people—and that starts with our employees.




Who we're looking for:

The Marketing Analytics team supports the company’s marketing efforts, while also working with teams throughout the organization. The analytics team is responsible for a number of business-critical reports and data models that our global marketing teams rely on for daily reporting, budgeting, and analysis. We measure marketing attribution to understand how people become Rover customers, provide campaign reporting to monitor trends in cost efficiency and optimization, deliver lifecycle data to action against a variety of customer behaviors, and narrate the business to identify and prioritize new opportunities.




We are looking for an Analyst to support our Growth, International Expansion, Lifecycle, and SEO stakeholders with a focus on improving our reporting and dashboard structure. The ideal candidate will have experience working closely with business stakeholders and building data-driven narratives that enable clear decision making.




*This is a hybrid position that has the minimum expectation to work out of our Barcelona Office in the Poblenou neighborhood two days per week on Mondays and Thursdays. For this reason, candidates must be based in Barcelona or willing to relocate.




Your Responsibilities:

Work closely with analytics peers and marketing teams to narrate trends and insights, with a particular focus on our customer acquisition marketing programs.
Design reports and dashboards that enable clear, data-driven decision-making for marketing and cross-functional teams.
Refine our marketing attribution models to drive optimal resource allocation across paid and organic marketing channels.
Expand your expertise by supporting experiments such as A/B testing and Market Match tests to optimize strategies across multiple marketing functions.




Your Qualifications:

At least 2 years experience working with complex datasets to support business decision making.
Fluency in SQL.
Data visualisation tool experience (e.g. Mode, Looker, Tableau, etc.)
Ability to adapt your communication style to translate complex data insights for different audiences.
You have experience in owning small-to-medium projects from design to completion with limited guidance from your manager.
You understand when you are blocked, proactively seeking out for help within the team or the organization to move the project forward.




Nice to Have:

Python or R familiarity is helpful, but we welcome candidates eager to develop these skills.
Experience evaluating results of A/B tests as well as expertise in statistical analysis.
Understanding of marketing metrics such as clicks, CPC, CTR, impressions, and unit economics like customer LTV, payback period, and CAC.




Benefits of working at Rover:

Competitive compensation
Long-term incentive plan with a company performance-based cash payout
Permanent contract
Pension plan
Meal tickets through Cobee
Generous PTO allowance
Private health insurance
Discounted gym membership
Bring your dog to work (and unlimited puppy time)
Monetary help for adopting a dog or cat plus yearly credit to use on our platform
A wide variety of snacks, fresh fruit, and beverages in our kitchen to keep yourself going
Regular team activities, including happy hours, game nights, and more




Rover is an equal-opportunity employer committed to promoting a diverse, inclusive, and inventive environment with the best employees. We’re driven by seeing our people succeed and grow, and we work to ensure everyone contributes to their fullest potential. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, protected veteran status, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable laws, regulations, and ordinances.

Show more

We’re driven by seeing our people succeed and grow, and we work to ensure everyone contributes to their fullest potential. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, protected veteran status, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable laws, regulations, and ordinances.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Experian is a global data and technology company, powering opportunities for people and businesses around the world. We help to redefine lending practices, uncover and prevent fraud, simplify healthcare, deliver digital marketing solutions, and gain deeper insights into the automotive market, all using our unique combination of data, analytics and software. We also assist millions of people to realise their financial goals and help them to save time and money.

We operate across a range of markets, from financial services to healthcare, automotive, agrifinance, insurance, and many more industry segments.

We invest in talented people and new advanced technologies to unlock the power of data and to innovate. A FTSE 100 Index company listed on the London Stock Exchange (EXPN), we have a team of 23,300 people across 32 countries. Our corporate headquarters are in Dublin, Ireland. Learn more at experianplc.com.

Job Description

You'll work with the Senior Analyst and collaborate across teams to deliver impactful insights through advanced data visualization and analysis. You'll design Tableau dashboards, ensuring data accuracy, explaining performance trends and aligning reporting standards across the business. You will report into the Analytics Manager.

What You Will Do


Work with the Senior analyst and provide guidance to any junior analyst
Engage with stakeholders to gain deep understanding of business context
Develop and maintain complex Tableau dashboards, ensuring they meet business needs
Gather and prepare data for dashboard development
Ensure high level of accuracy and high-quality delivery of dashboards to agreed timelines
Co-ordinate with the wider analytics and data teams on best practices
Align with the wider analytics team on metric definitions and ensure consistency in reporting
Contribute to the creation and maintenance of data transformation layers


Qualifications

What you will bring:


2+ years experience in data analytics role
Experienced in SQL
Intermediate/advanced proficiency in Tableau and data visualization
Advanced data analysis skills
Advanced data preparation and interrogation techniques
Ability to communicate complex data to a variety of audiences
Experience with git version management


Additional Information

What you will get:


Personal Development - career pathway for professional growth supported by learning and development programs and unlimited access to online educational training courses, learning materials & book.
Work environment - excellent work conditions with friendly environment, recognized team spirit, and fun and quality recreation time.
Social benefit package including life insurance, food vouchers, additional health insurance, monthly flex allowance and internet coverage, corporate discounts, marriage and childbirth / adoption allowance, Multisport card, Sharesave plan, Employee assistance program, а birthday gift and many other benefits!
Work-life balance - 25 days paid vacation, 1 additional day off for your birthday and extra 3 paid days for participation in Social responsibility event.
Opportunity for Flexible working hours and Home Office.


Experian is an Equal opportunity employer. Everyone can succeed at Experian and bring their whole self to work, irrespective of their gender, ethnicity, religion, colour, sexuality, physical ability or age. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know at the earliest opportunity.

This is a hybrid remote/in-office role.

Experian Careers - Creating a better tomorrow together

Find out what its like to work for Experian by clicking here

Title: Junior BI Consultant
Description:
Job Description

Support the BI strategy for our European NIQ clients, enabling them to self-serve using our tools. Scope, build and deliver solutions that meet their basic recurrent data needs. Leverage NIQ and third parties solutions to meet your value delivered target

Qualifications:


1-3 years of experience in client servicing in FMCG sector, especially in Business Intelligence
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Fluency in English
Proven experience in BI tools and data analysis such as Discover (NIQ) or PowerBI, Microstrategy
Previous experience working with: Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
Passion for learning and applying new technologies to business solutions.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Demonstrated project management skills and ability to manage multiple priorities
Building and maintaining effective work relationships
Good collaboration skills to meet client needs and achieve organizational goals
Ability to work in a remote-based environment


Key responsibilities:


Assist NIQ clients in understanding and utilizing BI tools effectively
Develop and propose BI solutions tailored to clients' recurrent data needs
Deliver on performance tracking and success measurement
Consult directly with clients and stakeholders on how to optimize uses of BI tools, applications for automation, analytics and reporting
Identify leads from client interactions, be able to channel these needs into business opportunities
Own end-to-end processes of in-scope reporting solutions across a variety of data sources (RMS, CPS, Omni)
Collaborate with internal teams to ensure client requirements are met
Work closely with manager and team leaders to assist in day-to-day BI customer support needs, deployment activities and transformation initiatives
Aid in user education for platform-specific instruction to drive usage/adoption of Business Intelligence tools and supporting clients with our performance measurement services.
Share best demonstrated practices in an open, creative and inclusive team culture.
Collaborate with fellow BI and Insights teammates to identify business process improvements, project efficiencies and revenue opportunities.
Be active and engaged in continuous learning opportunities to upskill yourself, our team and advance our core areas of expertise.


Additional Information

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

At NIQ, we are steadfast in our commitment to fostering an inclusive workplace that mirrors the rich diversity of the communities and markets we serve. We believe that embracing a wide range of perspectives drives innovation and excellence. All employment decisions at NIQ are made without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, sexual orientation, or gender identity), national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. We invite individuals who share our dedication to inclusivity and equity to join us in making a meaningful impact. To learn more about our ongoing efforts in diversity and inclusion, please visit the https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
¿Estás buscando un nuevo desafío?

¿Te gustaría ayudarnos a dar forma al futuro de los seguros de coche?

Prima podría ser el lugar ideal para ti.

Desde 2015, hemos estado usando nuestra pasión por los datos y la tecnología para reinventar el seguro del coche y ofrecer a los conductores una experiencia excelente a un precio competitivo. Nuestra historia comenzó en Italia, donde rápidamente nos convertimos en el proveedor número uno de seguros de coche online. De hecho, más de 4 millones de conductores confían en nosotros y ahora estamos expandiéndonos para ayudar a millones más de conductores en el Reino Unido y España.

Para impulsar ese crecimiento, necesitamos un/a Data Analyst para unirse a nuestro equipo de Online Sales & Marketing.

Este equipo es la carta de presentación de Prima.

Como parte de este equipo, ayudarás a dar a conocer Prima y a conectar con nuestra audiencia, utilizando ideas audaces y datos precisos. Desde el lanzamiento de campañas exitosas hasta la optimización del rendimiento, darás forma a nuestra marca en uno de los mercados más competitivos del mundo.

¿Con ganas de generar impacto? Aquí tienes los detalles

Lo que harás


Analizar datos de distintas áreas del negocio, incluyendo conversión online, eficiencia operativa y proyectos estratégicos.
Identificar oportunidades de mejora y apoyar la toma de decisiones basadas en datos en colaboración con equipos como Product, UX, Atención al Cliente y Marketing.
Diseñar y mantener dashboards e informes en Tableau que ayuden a monitorizar el rendimiento y facilitar el análisis.
Participar en la integración y automatización del intercambio de datos entre equipos locales y globales.
Colaborar con otros Data Analysts y Data Scientists para compartir buenas prácticas y fortalecer la cultura de datos en la compañía.
Apoyar en iniciativas clave del área de negocio, como el lanzamiento de nuevos canales o el desarrollo de modelos de atribución.


Lo que estamos buscando


Al menos 1 año de experiencia en análisis de datos.
Buena experiencia en la creación de datasets utilizando diferentes herramientas para manipulación y extracción de datos (MySQL, Redshift, PostgreSQL).
Buenas habilidades de visión de negocio.
Habilidades analíticas y experiencia en la creación de modelos en Excel o Tableau.
Grado universitario en campos afines al análisis de datos (Estadística, Matemáticas, Ingeniería, Informática, ADE o Economía).
Nivel de inglés medio-avanzado, imprescindible para comunicarse entre los equipos globales.


Deseable


Experiencia usando herramientas de web analytics como Google Analytics y Content Square.
Flexibilidad y actitud adaptativa.
Iniciativa y proactividad.


Por qué te encantará trabajar aquí

Queremos que Prima sea un lugar de trabajo feliz y enriquecedor. Así que, si decides unirte a nosotros, puedes esperar muchos beneficios.

🤸Solo Smart Working: Disfruta de un modelo híbrido, combinando días en casa y en la oficina. Y por si fuera poco, trabaja desde cualquier lugar hasta 30 días al año.

🏁Crece con nosotros: En Prima nos movemos rápido, pero lo hacemos juntos. Accede a recursos de aprendizaje, mentoría y un plan de crecimiento personalizado.

🌈 Desarrolla tu máximo potencial: Tu mejor trabajo empieza cuando te sientes bien. Disfruta de seguro médico privado, descuentos en gimnasios, programas de bienestar y apoyo para la salud mental.

¿Crees que encajas? ¡Postúlate ahora!

En Prima celebramos lo que te hace único/a. Si no cumples con todos los requisitos pero sientes pasión por este rol, igualmente queremos conocerte. La innovación prospera en la diversidad de perspectivas.

Prima se enorgullece de ser una empresa que ofrece igualdad de oportunidades. ¿Necesitas adaptaciones durante el proceso? Escríbenos a talent.acquisition@prima.it. Construyamos juntos el futuro del seguro.
Show more
HTML:
¿Estás buscando un nuevo desafío?

¿Te gustaría ayudarnos a dar forma al futuro de los seguros de coche?

Prima podría ser el lugar ideal para ti.

Desde 2015, hemos estado usando nuestra pasión por los datos y la tecnología para reinventar el seguro del coche y ofrecer a los conductores una experiencia excelente a un precio competitivo. Nuestra historia comenzó en Italia, donde rápidamente nos convertimos en el proveedor número uno de seguros de coche online. De hecho, más de 4 millones de conductores confían en nosotros y ahora estamos expandiéndonos para ayudar a millones más de conductores en el Reino Unido y España.

Para impulsar ese crecimiento, necesitamos un/a Data Analyst para unirse a nuestro equipo de Online Sales & Marketing.

Este equipo es la carta de presentación de Prima.

Como parte de este equipo, ayudarás a dar a conocer Prima y a conectar con nuestra audiencia, utilizando ideas audaces y datos precisos. Desde el lanzamiento de campañas exitosas hasta la optimización del rendimiento, darás forma a nuestra marca en uno de los mercados más competitivos del mundo.

¿Con ganas de generar impacto? Aquí tienes los detalles

Lo que harás

  • Analizar datos de distintas áreas del negocio, incluyendo conversión online, eficiencia operativa y proyectos estratégicos.
  • Identificar oportunidades de mejora y apoyar la toma de decisiones basadas en datos en colaboración con equipos como Product, UX, Atención al Cliente y Marketing.
  • Diseñar y mantener dashboards e informes en Tableau que ayuden a monitorizar el rendimiento y facilitar el análisis.
  • Participar en la integración y automatización del intercambio de datos entre equipos locales y globales.
  • Colaborar con otros Data Analysts y Data Scientists para compartir buenas prácticas y fortalecer la cultura de datos en la compañía.
  • Apoyar en iniciativas clave del área de negocio, como el lanzamiento de nuevos canales o el desarrollo de modelos de atribución.

Lo que estamos buscando

  • Al menos 1 año de experiencia en análisis de datos.
  • Buena experiencia en la creación de datasets utilizando diferentes herramientas para manipulación y extracción de datos (MySQL, Redshift, PostgreSQL).
  • Buenas habilidades de visión de negocio.
  • Habilidades analíticas y experiencia en la creación de modelos en Excel o Tableau.
  • Grado universitario en campos afines al análisis de datos (Estadística, Matemáticas, Ingeniería, Informática, ADE o Economía).
  • Nivel de inglés medio-avanzado, imprescindible para comunicarse entre los equipos globales.

Deseable

  • Experiencia usando herramientas de web analytics como Google Analytics y Content Square.
  • Flexibilidad y actitud adaptativa.
  • Iniciativa y proactividad.

Por qué te encantará trabajar aquí

Queremos que Prima sea un lugar de trabajo feliz y enriquecedor. Así que, si decides unirte a nosotros, puedes esperar muchos beneficios.

🤸Solo Smart Working: Disfruta de un modelo híbrido, combinando días en casa y en la oficina. Y por si fuera poco, trabaja desde cualquier lugar hasta 30 días al año.

🏁Crece con nosotros: En Prima nos movemos rápido, pero lo hacemos juntos. Accede a recursos de aprendizaje, mentoría y un plan de crecimiento personalizado.

🌈 Desarrolla tu máximo potencial: Tu mejor trabajo empieza cuando te sientes bien. Disfruta de seguro médico privado, descuentos en gimnasios, programas de bienestar y apoyo para la salud mental.

¿Crees que encajas? ¡Postúlate ahora!

En Prima celebramos lo que te hace único/a. Si no cumples con todos los requisitos pero sientes pasión por este rol, igualmente queremos conocerte. La innovación prospera en la diversidad de perspectivas.

Prima se enorgullece de ser una empresa que ofrece igualdad de oportunidades. ¿Necesitas adaptaciones durante el proceso? Escríbenos a talent.acquisition@prima.it. Construyamos juntos el futuro del seguro.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
About Happy Mammoth:

Happy Mammoth is a high-growth e-commerce company dedicated to empowering women’s health through natural, science-backed supplements focused on gut, digestive, and hormonal wellness. As a performance-driven company, we are passionate about making a meaningful, lasting impact on our customers' lives. You can learn more about us at https://happymammoth.com/.

Before you dive deeper, please note the following key points:


This is a fully remote contractor role, available full-time
The role requires availability during EU hours (GMT)


At Happy Mammoth, you can expect:


A strong salary package
A welcoming and nurturing work environment, with colleagues from around the world
A fast-paced, dynamic, and non-corporate atmosphere where adaptability is key
The chance to be part of our exciting global expansion journey
Flexible working hours
Free access to courses, books and Masterminds
Opportunities for professional growth and development


Job Summary:

As a Data Analyst at Happy Mammoth, you’ll be at the heart of our data-driven efforts. Your insights will directly influence our strategies to optimize customer acquisition, retention, and lifetime value. In this role, you’ll dive into customer behavior, analyze marketing performance, and provide actionable insights that drive our direct-response and B2C marketing initiatives.

Responsibilities:


Collect, analyze, and interpret data to uncover trends, patterns, and insights that inform our business strategies
Build, maintain, and automate dashboards and reports to track KPIs, including ROAS, CPA, conversion rates, CLTV, and customer retention metrics
Work closely with cross-functional teams, such as marketing, product, and finance, to provide data-driven insights that support campaign performance and strategic marketing decisions
Provide ad hoc analysis to address specific business questions
Ensure data quality and accuracy by regularly validating and cleansing datasets
Communicate findings effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders through reports, presentations, and storytelling


Qualifications:


Proven experience in data analysis, preferably with a focus on e-commerce
Proficiency in SQL and Excel
Proven experience in data visualization tools (e.g. Looker Data Studio, Looker, Power BI or similar)
Hands-on experience with cloud-based data warehouses and architectures (familiarity with Google BigQuery is a strong asset)
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
Effective communicator with the ability to convey complex data insights clearly


What will set you apart:


You have a genuine hunger for success in all parts of your life
You thrive taking action, taking responsibility and getting things done before deadlines
You’re able to self-manage based upon the overall scope and work required
You’re able to diagnose and solve technical problems quickly
You're able to work as part of a team and actively contribute to conversations
A willingness to learn and grow with the business


CVs should be in English

Powered by JazzHR

Title: Marketing Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Deine Aufgaben bei uns


Your responsibilities





Manage and analyze large datasets from multiple sources (SQL databases, Google Ads, Meta Ads, TikTok Ads, etc.)


Automate recurring reporting processes (Google Sheets, Looker Studio, etc.) and reduce manual work


Build dashboards and reporting pipelines that provide clear insights into campaign and funnel performance


Conduct advanced statistical analysis (regressions, predictive models, machine learning approaches, attribution models) to uncover insights and optimize decision-making


Support the team in developing and refining a multi-touch attribution model


Collaborate with the marketing team to ensure data accuracy and transparency across all channels



Das bringst Du mit


Your profile





Strong background in data analysis with excellent SQL skills


Solid understanding of marketing metrics and KPIs (especially in paid performance marketing)


Experience in automating data workflows (Python, R, or similar is a plus)


Knowledge of statistical methods, regressions, or machine learning techniques (plus)


Hands-on experience with data visualization and reporting tools (Looker Studio, Tableau, Power BI, or similar)


A structured and detail-oriented working style with a passion for solving complex problems


Proficiency in English; German is a plus but not required



Das bieten wir Dir


What we offer





A chance to make a real impact in healthcare recruiting


A dynamic and fast-growing environment with room to take ownership


Collaboration with a passionate and international team


Hybrid work model from our Berlin office


Competitive salary and development opportunities





As Marketing Data Analyst at Pflegia, you will be the go-to person for everything related to marketing data. You will structure, analyze, and automate our reporting processes to enable data-driven decision-making at scale. You will work closely with our performance marketing and product teams, but your main focus will be data analysis and automation rather than campaign management.




At Pflegia, our mission is to transform the healthcare recruiting industry by connecting qualified nursing professionals with the right employers faster and more efficiently. As we continue to grow, we are looking for a Marketing Data Analyst (m/f/d) to strengthen our marketing team with deep expertise in data, automation, and advanced analytics.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (Cloud & BI Solutions)




Do you enjoy turning business challenges into data-driven insights? Are you comfortable working with stakeholders, analyzing datasets, and guiding others in their growth? We’re looking for a Data Analyst to strengthen our team and help shape impactful, cloud-based data solutions.




What you’ll be doing:

Work closely with business stakeholders to understand processes and translate their needs into clear data requirements.
Frame business questions into testable hypotheses that lead to real insights.
Prepare and analyze datasets, collaborating with data engineers and modelers to create scalable solutions.
Apply data modeling approaches (both dimensional and relational) to support reporting and analytics.
Design compelling data visualizations and dashboards using tools such as Power BI.
Contribute to the development of new data propositions and analytical frameworks.




What you bring:

A completed WO or HBO degree (technical background preferred) with academic-level thinking and problem-solving ability.
At least 3 years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a consultancy role involving data-driven projects.
Experience working with SQL (Python and/or R is a plus).
Familiarity with business intelligence and reporting tools.
Experience with project methodologies such as Agile, Scrum, or DevOps is an advantage.
Fluency in Dutch and English.

Title: DATA ANALYST-SETTORE BANCARIO
Description:
se per i numeri nutri una passione smisurata, questa è l'offerta che fa per te!




Synergie Italia - filiale di Asti ricerca una risorsa da inserire all’interno dell’Ufficio Controlli, dedicato alle attività di monitoraggio e analisi periodiche presso prestigioso Istituto Bancario. La figura supporterà i processi di controllo interno, garantendo la corretta raccolta, gestione e trattamento dei dati necessari per le verifiche aziendali.




Posizione

ti occuperai di:

Analisi e trattamento dati a supporto delle attività di controllo
Esecuzione di monitoraggi periodici secondo procedure interne
Redazione di reportistica e documentazione a supporto delle attività di audit
Collaborazione con le altre funzioni aziendali per la gestione delle evidenze




Requisiti

Laurea specialistica in Economia o Ingegneria Gestionale
Competenze intermedie nell’analisi e gestione dei dati
Buona padronanza del pacchetto Office (in particolare Excel)
Precisione, capacità analitiche e attenzione al dettaglio
Attitudine al lavoro in team e buone doti organizzative




offerta:

somministrazione a tempo determinato a scopo assuntivo 6+6 mesi - CCNL Credito - RAL 35K
Inserimento in un contesto bancario strutturato e dinamico
Formazione on the job e possibilità di crescita professionale

Altre informazioni







L'offerta è rivolta a candidatə nel rispetto del Dlgs 198/2006 e dei Dlgs 215/2003 e 216/2003.

Le persone interessate sono invitate a leggere l'informativa privacy ex artt. 13 e 14 del Reg. UE 2016/679.

Aut. Min. Prot. N. 1207 – SG del 16/12/2004

Title: DATA ANALYST
Description:
SEND YOUR CV FOR EXPLORATORY INTERVIEWS - WE ARE LOOKING FOR OUR COLLEAGUES OF TOMORROW!

Data Analytics – Corporate – Milan

Hello, we’re L’Oréal.

We're not just building brands; we're shaping how the world experiences beauty (and it takes a lot of cool jobs to do it). Intrigued? Keep reading—this might be the opportunity you’ve been searching for.

A Day in the Life

As part of our Italian Data Analytics team, reporting to the Data Director, you’ll play a key role in driving data-driven decision-making across the organization. Collaborating with the Europe Data Team and local divisions and stakeholders, you’ll work on exciting projects that combine innovation, analytics, and business impact.

Here’s What Your Day-to-day Might Look Like


Analytics Solution Development: Analyze functional requirements, develop technical specifications, and create analytics solutions, including MVPs and POCs.
Ad Hoc Analytics: Conduct in-depth data analysis, identify patterns, and provide actionable insights to cross-functional teams.
Project Management: Define business cases, monitor KPIs, and manage project plans and budgets.
Continuous Improvement: Stay ahead of analytics trends and share knowledge within the team.
Quality Assurance: Ensure data accuracy and maintain high-quality documentation.


You’ll Thrive In This Role If You


Have expertise in data manipulation and analysis tools (e.g., SQL, Python, R) and data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI).
Are skilled in statistical methods and have a strong attention to detail.
Excel in communication and presentation, making complex data accessible to all.
Are passionate about using data to drive business impact.
Speak fluent Italian and English and hold a Master’s degree in a relevant field.


What’s In It For You


A place for you to leave your comfort zone and grow beyond your potential (here, you’ll be encouraged to try new things and take risks!).
Real responsibility from day 1—there’s no sitting on the sidelines at L’Oréal.
An environment where people of every ethnicity, social background, age, religion, gender, and sexual orientation and disabilities are accepted, can speak up, will thrive, and are celebrated!
A place where you can contribute to something bigger! Many of our brands have societal/environmental causes to make a concrete difference.


Who We Are

L’Oréal is present in 150 markets on five continents. For more than a century, L’Oréal has devoted itself solely to ‘Create beauty that moves the world’; it is now the industry world leader with €42 billion consolidated sales. Together, we solve complex challenges at scale while making sure we stay committed to making the world a more inclusive and a better place for everyone & our planet.

We’re committed to guaranteeing inclusive recruitment processes and to advocating for hiring and promoting each candidate in an ethical and equitable way. The Group strictly prohibits discrimination against any applicant for employment because of the individual’s gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, visible and/or invisible disabilities, socio-economic and/or multicultural origins, health conditions, age, religion, or any other characteristics protected by law.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
A Job? Or a Lifetime Experience? Start Yours Here!




A nossa missão é ser uma parte significativa da carreira das nossas pessoas. À medida que crescemos, cresce também a determinação em oferecer a melhor experiência aos nossos colaboradores e clientes e é exatamente isso que nos move. Somos uma empresa portuguesa de consultoria tecnológica com escritórios em Lisboa, Porto e Óbidos e representações no Brasil e Tunísia. Contamos com mais de 12 anos de expertise no mercado, e hoje somos um universo de cerca de 400 pessoas a trabalhar em contexto presencial, remoto ou híbrido em projetos em mais de 20 países.




Acreditamos que grandes pessoas fazem empresas de sucesso e por isso mesmo defendemos a valorização, reconhecimento e crescimento dos nossos profissionais.




Não queremos ser mais uma linha do teu CV, queremos que connosco vivas uma Lifetime Experience. Apostamos em formações e certificações que confirmam a tua real progressão, na promoção de um saudável work-life balance e na oferta de benefícios com impacto na tua vida pessoal e carreira.




Principais Responsabilidades:




Estruturar, tratar e consolidar dados provenientes de diferentes fontes.
Configurar e manter recursos de reporting em Power BI.
Parametrizar e manter automatismos de suporte com Power Automate.
Desenvolver métricas de análise para processos de entrega e melhoria contínua.
Apoiar as equipas operacionais e de gestão de projetos, garantindo evolução contínua.
Elaborar documentação de suporte detalhada para relatórios, modelos de dados e automatismos.




O que procuramos:




Formação em Engenharia Informática, Matemática ou equivalente;
Experiência mínima de 3 anos em funções de gestão e manipulação de dados;
Mais de 3 anos de experiência com Microsoft Power BI.
Mais de 2 anos de experiência em Microsoft Power Automate.
Conhecimentos em SQL Server serão valorizados
Bons conhecimentos de inglês (B2).




Ser Affinity




#Affinidade – Criares relações de proximidade e empatia com colegas, clientes e candidatos (e não apenas com tecnologias, linguagens e plataformas). Espírito de equipa e boa disposição;
#Ambição – Quereres fazer mais e melhor. Vontade de exceder expectativas e evoluir pessoal e profissionalmente;
#Ação – Energia para fazer acontecer. Mostrares proatividade e capacidade de iniciativa;
#Aprendizagem – Vontade de evoluir individual e coletivamente e tornares-te um expert no mercado tecnológico.




A tua #LifetimeExperience




Participar em projetos nacionais e internacionais numa empresa baseada em relacionamentos pessoais, na simplicidade e na eficiência, com uma ação disruptiva no mercado tecnológico;
Aceder a um plano de carreira e formação personalizado e diretamente proporcional ao teu desempenho e interesse;
Fazer parte de um ambiente acolhedor, de confiança, respeito e informalidade;
Integrar as nossas Affinity Communities (de desporto, tecnologia, hobbies, etc.) e participar ativamente em projetos de responsabilidade social e ambiental;
Tirar partido de um conjunto de benefícios, parcerias, descontos eventos e dinâmicas internas.




Para além da tua satisfação profissional queremos proporcionar-te oportunidades de lazer e convívio memoráveis e dignos de uma experiência Affinity.




Join the Experience!




Envia-nos a tua candidatura e aproveita para nos conhecer e ir acompanhando em:

https://www.instagram.com/affinityportugal/

https://www.linkedin.com/company/2701281/admin/

https://twitter.com/WithAffinity

Show more
HTML:
A Job? Or a Lifetime Experience? Start Yours Here!


A nossa missão é ser uma parte significativa da carreira das nossas pessoas. À medida que crescemos, cresce também a determinação em oferecer a melhor experiência aos nossos colaboradores e clientes e é exatamente isso que nos move. Somos uma empresa portuguesa de consultoria tecnológica com escritórios em Lisboa, Porto e Óbidos e representações no Brasil e Tunísia. Contamos com mais de 12 anos de expertise no mercado, e hoje somos um universo de cerca de 400 pessoas a trabalhar em contexto presencial, remoto ou híbrido em projetos em mais de 20 países.


Acreditamos que grandes pessoas fazem empresas de sucesso e por isso mesmo defendemos a valorização, reconhecimento e crescimento dos nossos profissionais.


Não queremos ser mais uma linha do teu CV, queremos que connosco vivas uma Lifetime Experience. Apostamos em formações e certificações que confirmam a tua real progressão, na promoção de um saudável work-life balance e na oferta de benefícios com impacto na tua vida pessoal e carreira.


Principais Responsabilidades:


  • Estruturar, tratar e consolidar dados provenientes de diferentes fontes.
  • Configurar e manter recursos de reporting em Power BI.
  • Parametrizar e manter automatismos de suporte com Power Automate.
  • Desenvolver métricas de análise para processos de entrega e melhoria contínua.
  • Apoiar as equipas operacionais e de gestão de projetos, garantindo evolução contínua.
  • Elaborar documentação de suporte detalhada para relatórios, modelos de dados e automatismos.


O que procuramos:


  • Formação em Engenharia Informática, Matemática ou equivalente;
  • Experiência mínima de 3 anos em funções de gestão e manipulação de dados;
  • Mais de 3 anos de experiência com Microsoft Power BI.
  • Mais de 2 anos de experiência em Microsoft Power Automate.
  • Conhecimentos em SQL Server serão valorizados
  • Bons conhecimentos de inglês (B2).


Ser Affinity


  • #Affinidade – Criares relações de proximidade e empatia com colegas, clientes e candidatos (e não apenas com tecnologias, linguagens e plataformas). Espírito de equipa e boa disposição;
