  • #Aprendizagem – Vontade de evoluir individual e coletivamente e tornares-te um expert no mercado tecnológico.


A tua #LifetimeExperience


  • Participar em projetos nacionais e internacionais numa empresa baseada em relacionamentos pessoais, na simplicidade e na eficiência, com uma ação disruptiva no mercado tecnológico;
  • Aceder a um plano de carreira e formação personalizado e diretamente proporcional ao teu desempenho e interesse;
  • Fazer parte de um ambiente acolhedor, de confiança, respeito e informalidade;
  • Integrar as nossas Affinity Communities (de desporto, tecnologia, hobbies, etc.) e participar ativamente em projetos de responsabilidade social e ambiental;
  • Tirar partido de um conjunto de benefícios, parcerias, descontos eventos e dinâmicas internas.


Para além da tua satisfação profissional queremos proporcionar-te oportunidades de lazer e convívio memoráveis e dignos de uma experiência Affinity.


Join the Experience!

https://www.instagram.com/affinityportugal/

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Las Rozas de Madrid, Community of Madrid, Spain
Description:
Meta Engineering acumula más de 40 años de historia en la prestación de servicios de consultoría en ingeniería en todo tipo de infraestructuras. Nuestro especial compromiso con el medio ambiente, nos ha convertido en un referente en movilidad sostenible y en generación de energías renovables.




Ofrecemos servicios de ingeniería totalmente personalizados a lo largo de todo el ciclo de vida del proyecto, que van desde el diseño preliminar y los estudios de viabilidad hasta el diseño de detalle, implementación, supervisión, puesta en servicio, pruebas, operación y explotación del proyecto y mantenimiento de infraestructuras, obras de construcción e instalaciones.




Precisamos incorporar un/a Data Analyst para unirse a nuestro equipo.




¿Qué funciones realizarás?




Extraer, procesar y modelar datos provenientes de distintas fuentes (como ERPs tipo Business Central, CRMs, plataformas web, etc.).
Diseñar y mantener dashboards dinámicos e interactivos en Power BI, utilizando Power Query para transformar y relacionar los datos.
Elaborar y optimizar consultas en SQL para organizar y estructurar grandes volúmenes de información.
Automatizar tareas y procesos mediante programación en Python, especialmente en flujos ETL y generación de reportes.
Colaborar con distintos equipos para entender sus necesidades y traducirlas en soluciones de análisis efectivas.
Revisar y mejorar continuamente los modelos de datos y procesos de análisis para asegurar eficiencia y escalabilidad.
Garantizar que los informes generados reflejen los KPIs clave y contribuyan a una mejor toma de decisiones.




¿Qué buscamos?




Experiencia previa de al menos 3 años como Data Analyst o roles similares.
Dominio de Fabric, Power BI, Dax, Power Query, SQL con conocimientos sólidos en modelado de datos.
Amplia experiencia en Excel tanto en macros como Power Query dentro de Excel.
Experiencia trabajando con ERP Business Central (u otros similares).
Conocimientos de Python orientado al análisis de datos y automatización.
Capacidad para traducir datos complejos en recomendaciones comprensibles y accionables para el negocio.
Habilidad para trabajar en equipo, con buena comunicación y orientación a resultados.







¿Qué te ofrecemos?




Incorporación inmediata con contrato de trabajo estable.
Retribución en función de la valía del candidato/a.
Horario flexible y, jornada intensiva todos los viernes y los meses de julio y agosto.
Paquete de retribución flexible con ventajas fiscales: seguro médico, formación, restauración, transporte y guardería.
Formar parte de un equipo multidisciplinar, capaz de desarrollar de manera integrada todos los ámbitos de un proyecto de ingeniería.




Meta Engineering es una empresa comprometida con la igualdad de oportunidades entre mujeres y hombres, la inclusión y la diversidad y, valoramos todas las solicitudes sin discriminación.




Si crees que cumples con los requisitos ¿Te unes a nuestro equipo? ¡Te estamos esperando! 🚀

Title: DATA & ORGANIZATIONAL ANALYST
Description:
Per una delle nostre Competence Development Area della sede di Roma ricerchiamo una persona con Laurea Magistrale in Economia, Statistica o Ingegneria Gestionale.

La persona si occuperà di mappatura, analisi e reingegnerizzazione dei processi aziendali, revisione e formalizzazione della normativa interna, definizione dei modelli operativi di funzionamento, gestione della job architecture aziendale e delle job evaluation manageriali, supporto specialistico per i progetti strategici del Gruppo.

In particolare, tale attività dovrà essere svolta con riferimento al processo di integrazione delle competenze funzionali al percorso di trasformazione aziendale in atto.

Le competenze tecniche richieste sono le seguenti:


Process Design
Project Management
Data Analysis
Organizational Management
Job Evaluation
Conoscenza MS Office Excel, Word e Power Point
Conoscenza della lingua inglese


Alle persone interessate viene richiesta una seniority di almento due anni, oltre a spiccate capacità di relazione, negoziazione e comunicazione, proattività, propensione a lavorare in team, capacità di problem solving, orientamento al risultato.

Costituiscono, infine, titoli preferenziali la conoscenza di PowerBI e di strumenti di Data Analysis, AI, SAP, Success Factor.

Offriamo un contratto di lavoro a tempo indeterminato e formazione continua, unitamente all’opportunità di lavorare in un contesto dinamico e strategico per il presidio dei processi di TIM.

Sede: Roma
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Join The Game!

Leader in the development and publishing of games, Gameloft® has established itself as a pioneer in the industry, creating innovative gaming experiences for over 20 years. Gameloft creates games for all digital platforms, from mobile to cross-platform titles for PC and consoles. Gameloft operates its own established franchises such as Asphalt®, Dragon Mania Legends, Modern Combat and Dungeon Hunter and also partners with major rights holders including LEGO®, Universal, Illumination Entertainment, Hasbro®, Fox Digital Entertainment, Mattel®, Lamborghini®, and Ferrari®. Gameloft distributes its games in over 100 countries and employs 3,000 people worldwide. Every month, 55 million unique users can be reached by advertisers in Gameloft games with Gameloft for brands, a leading B2B offering dedicated to brands and agencies. Gameloft is a Vivendi company. 



In collaboration with Product Managers, Game Economy Designers, Game Designers, Marketing Managers the Data Analyst will collect, clean, analyze, and automatize data exploitation process. The Data Analyst will have to model, predict, segment vast amounts of data from our customers. Last but not least, the Data Analyst will work with an international team of data experts, share knowledge, and contribute to the data technical data team skill increase.

As Data Analyst in Gameloft Sofia your role would be to


Build both large systematic reports and one-off small pieces of analysis
Provide on-going reporting and performance monitoring from multiple data sources
Create and update SQL computer programs for game analysis
Collaborate to the development of interactive applications for data mining and visualization
Proactively develop new analyses and insights, to drive decisions and strategies for user acquisition, retention, and monetization
Debug and solve issues to ensure delivery of accurate metrics



Significant experience performing quantitative analysis, preferably for an Internet or technology company
B.S. or B.A. in math, BI, economics, engineering or other technical field required
Excellent SQL skills extensive experience querying large, complex datasets
Excellent Data Visualization skills
Ability to create complex data flows and algorithms
Proven ability to work in a fast-paced environment and to meet changing deadlines and priorities on multiple simultaneous projects
Excellent organizational, communication and interpersonal skills
Enjoy working in both individual and team settings
Working English is desirable
Strong interest for video games


Considered a plus


Experience with Python/R
Experience with Looker, Power BI, Tableau
Understanding of advanced statistical methodologies
Understanding of business models and monetization strategies


Why Join Gameloft Universe?


You want to work in an exceptional industry and create games downloaded by millions of players every day
You want to be part of a talented and supportive team of pioneers who have a passion for creating video games
You want to contribute to a vibrant and dynamic atmosphere
You want to join a global company and meet great people around the world
You are looking for a fun place to work in the heart of Sofia and excellent transport connections
You want to work on a permanent contract with competitive remuneration and benefits package


Our Benefits


Additional Health Insurance with excellent coverage, including dental care & dioptric glasses reimbursement
Flexible working time on hybrid mode with short Friday option
Food vouchers – 200 lv. per month
Several options for active lifestyle – both Multisport and Coolfit cards available
20 days paid annual leave + 1 birthday day off
Referral & Baby Bonus
Modern & Cozy office in Sofia Tower 2 (Mall of Sofia) with a lot of gaming temptations – table tennis, air hockey, PS5, great board games collection, etc.
Hot beverages at your disposal on daily basis + fresh fruits & snacks on weekly
Access to office library, trainings and career development plan
Active studio life – different events, parties, charity initiatives and more
Occasional Gifts – celebrate special moments
Exclusive discount program from retailers, restaurants, tech suppliers and more


If you are interested in our job offer, please send a CV. Applications will be processed in confidentiality.

Title: Data Analyst – Power BI
Description:
¿Quiénes somos?

Neotalent Conclusion es una de las mayores especialistas del mercado ibérico en captación y gestión de talento informático y de ingeniería. Como parte del grupo neerlandés Conclusion, que se compone por un ecosistema de 25 empresas y 3.600 empleados, nos centramos en aumentar la capacidad tecnológica de nuestros clientes y acelerar la transformación digital de los mismos.

En Neotalent Conclusion, somos especialistas del talento. Atraemos a los mejores profesionales y los combinamos con los proyectos más ambiciosos, en el momento justo. Nuestro éxito radica en la inversión en innovación, orientación a resultados y, por encima de todo, en la garantía de que las personas tengan carreras felices y realizadoras.




Con más de 25 años de experiencia, Neotalent Conclusion cuenta con oficinas en Madrid, Lisboa y Oporto. Nuestra compañía está formada por un equipo de más de 850 profesionales entre sus diferentes áreas de operación.




Neotalent, the responsive people.




Más información en www.neotalent.pt/es y https://neotalent.pt/es/oportunidades-de-carrera/.




En Neotalent Conclusion, buscamos incorporar un/a Senior Data Analyst para trabajar con nuestro cliente del sector de seguros




Esta es una excelente oportunidad para profesionales con perfil técnico y pasión por los datos que deseen evolucionar en un entorno ágil, innovador y colaborativo.




Cuáles serán tus funciones:

Administración y mantenimiento de la plataforma de Business Intelligence Soporte y mentoría al equipo
Desarrollo de tableros y reportes para monitoreo y toma de decisiones
Administración y mantenimiento de la plataforma de Business Intelligence
Soporte y mentoría al equipo
Desarrollo de tableros y reportes para monitoreo y toma de decisiones
Reportes y tableros (dashboards)




Qué perfil buscamos:

Experiencia en la administración de Power BI Premium, visualización y modelado de datos.
Soporte a usuarios de datos y mentoría.
Inglés B2-C1. Trabajarás en colaboración con un equipo internacional, por lo que hablar en inglés es indispensable para la posición.




Habilidades técnicas requeridas:

Power BI Premium
DAX
SQL
Python
Azure DevOps
Azure Databricks
Excel
PowerPoint




Valoramos positivamente:

Microsoft Fabric
Aspectos de seguridad, redes y gobernanza




Por qué unirte a nosotros:

Trabajar en proyectos desafiantes para grandes clientes
Modalidad de trabajo: Híbrida en Barcelona, 2 días presenciales, 3 teletrabajo.
Contrato Indefinido con Neotalent Conclusion
Aprender más sobre tecnologías emergentes
Posibilidad de trabajar de forma remota
Acceso a formación continua y certificaciones
Disfrutar de un plan de compensación flexible
... ¡y mucho más!

  • Acceso a formación continua y certificaciones
  • Disfrutar de un plan de compensación flexible
  • ... ¡y mucho más!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you passionate about information hidden in data, programming, and finance?

In Swedbank you have the opportunity to:


Be a part of the Business Steering team in Corporates & Institutions, focusing on the corporate segment in Swedbank’s Business
Monitor portfolios, perform ‘deep dives’ in large amounts of data using SQL. Assist management and other stakeholders with data driven insights
Use your skills within programming and statistics to process data
Through data driven insights help the corporate business to take informed decisions
Understand how operational processes / policies impact KPIs across a diverse range of disciplines and work with colleagues to show how changing processes / steering can lead to better outcomes



What is needed in this role:


A creative and problem-solving mindset as well as an ambition to make a difference
An interest in the corporate banking business
An understanding of the product universe within a bank. Preferable also experience with the information in Swedbank’s data warehouses
Excellent communication skill to be able to convey ideas and analytical results effectively verbally and in writing to a non-technical audience
University degree in a technical field such as statistics, mathematics, economics or engineering
Practical experience, minimum 2 years, within an analytical framework (e.g. R / Python / SAS) and experience using SQL.



With us, you can experience:


Personal and professional growth through self-leadership and continuous development.
Meaningful work that positively impacts our workplace, our customers, and society.
An open and collaborative culture that encourages cross-functional teamwork and provides networking opportunities.
A supportive and inclusive environment that promotes a balanced and sustainable work-life, with flexible working conditions when suitable for the role.
Benefits such as our share based reward program Eken, company pension plan, employee offer for banking products, health insurance.





"Join our team and...

You will work with an agile team, which jointly delivers a wide spectrum of business-critical insights and increase Swedbank’s competitive advantage. We believe in diversity and think it is very important to have an Open and Caring work environment. You will be given responsibility and we will be there to support you!" Johan Carlberg , your future manager

We look forward to receiving your application by 2025-09-15.

We work with continuous selection, which means that the position may be filled before the application deadline.

Location: Stockholm City

Recruiting manager: Johan Carlberg

We may begin the selection during the application period, so we welcome your application as soon as possible.

We have made our choice regarding recruitment media and therefore kindly decline contact with ad sellers or sellers of other recruitment services.

Swedbank does not discriminate anybody based on gender, age, sexual orientation or sexual identity, ethnicity, religion or disability – everybody is welcome.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Location: Fully Remote

Employment Type: Full-Time Contractor




About Us:




Bitcoinsensus is a leading entity in the cryptocurrency space, committed to sharing knowledge through multiple social media platforms and our website. We’re focused on real-time market analysis, comprehensive guides, industry news, and insightful reviews, serving a diverse audience ranging from blockchain and crypto beginners to experts.




Role Overview:

We’re seeking a skilled Data Analyst who can turn raw data into actionable insights. The role requires a deep understanding of how to work with complex datasets, identify trends, and communicate key findings to influence strategic decisions.




Key Responsibilities

Collect, clean, and interpret large datasets to uncover actionable insights.
Work with the engineering team to develop out the entire infrastructure to support the company’s data needs
Create dashboards, reports, and visualizations using tools such as Mixpanel, Tableau, Power BI, Superset or Looker.
Conduct in-depth analysis to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for business growth.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define KPIs and measure performance.
Support data-driven decision-making processes through data storytelling and by providing clear and concise recommendations.
Provide key reports, trends & insights that will enable the business to implement strategic & commercial decisions.
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and integrity across projects.




Qualifications & Skills

Please read below fully as a candidate that does not meet the requirements will not be considered:

Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Economics, or a related field.
5+ years of experience in data analysis or a similar role.
Proficiency in SQL and data visualization tools.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
A demonstrated commercial mindset and understanding on how to translate data & insights into critical business & commercial decisions is a must.
Experience with programming languages such as Python or R is a plus.
Excellent communication skills to convey insights to technical and non-technical stakeholders.




What We Offer

Salary that is based on your experience and skill set
Fully remote work setting

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

En MRM buscamos un/a Data Analyst para sumarse a nuestro equipo de Data Science & Business Intelligence, participando en proyectos innovadores para grandes marcas y sectores internacionales.

¿Qué harás?


Analizar comportamiento de usuarios y clientes mediante consultas SQL avanzadas, generando insights accionables para campañas y estrategias.
Recoger, estructurar e implementar briefings de análisis específicos adaptados a cada cliente o proyecto.
Diseñar y automatizar dashboards interactivos con herramientas como Power BI, Tableau, Qlik o Data Studio, orientados a marketing, ventas o customer experience.
Definir y aplicar metodologías estadísticas como A/B Testing y grupos de control paramedir impacto real de acciones.
Coordinar y asegurar la entrega de reports periódicos con foco en calidad, claridad y puntualidad.
Comunicar resultados y hallazgos de manera clara y con visión estratégica, tanto a nivel interno como en reuniones con cliente externo.


¿Qué buscamos en ti?


Espíritu de equipo y capacidad para trabajar en entornos colaborativos con perfiles de distintas disciplinas, países y culturas.
Proactividad, energía positiva y fuerte ambición profesional.
Atención al detalle y mentalidad analítica.
Creatividad e innovación: no buscamos replicadores de modelos, sino personas que aporten ideas nuevas y valientes.
Mentalidad crítica y orientada a la mejora continua.
Capacidad de adaptación a la presión sin perder foco en la calidad.
Gusto por el marketing, el entorno digital y la relación con los datos.


Requisitos Técnicos Imprescindibles


SQL avanzado: agilidad en la extracción, manipulación y análisis de grandes volúmenes de datos. Súper enfocado en el dato, con gran cuidado en la precisión de los resultados asegurando unos entregables de calidad y 100% fiables.
Conocimiento sólido de entornos de BI y analítica.
Experiencia con herramientas de visualización (Power BI, Tableau, Qlik, Data Studio).
Rigor y cuidado extremo en validaciones y revisiones de datos.
Capacidad de estructurar briefings y transformar preguntas de negocio en análisis efectivos.


Sobre MRM

MRM es una agencia de experiencias digitales que ofrece soluciones creativas transformadoras en la intersección de los negocios, el data y la tecnología. MRM opera de forma integrada y sin fronteras, para permitir una mayor colaboración y velocidad, todo ello con el objetivo de ayudar a las empresas a establecer relaciones significativas con las personas. MRM forma parte de McCann Worldgroup y del grupo de empresas Interpublic (NYSE: IPG) y cuenta con 35 oficinas en América del Norte, América Latina, Europa, Oriente Medio y Asia Pacífico.


McCann Worldgroup manifiesta su compromiso con la igualdad y la diversidad.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
About Happy Mammoth:

Happy Mammoth is a high-growth e-commerce company dedicated to empowering women’s health through natural, science-backed supplements focused on gut, digestive, and hormonal wellness. As a performance-driven company, we are passionate about making a meaningful, lasting impact on our customers' lives. You can learn more about us at https://happymammoth.com/.

Before you dive deeper, please note the following key points:


This is a fully remote contractor role, available full-time
The role requires availability during EU hours (GMT)


At Happy Mammoth, you can expect:


A strong salary package
A welcoming and nurturing work environment, with colleagues from around the world
A fast-paced, dynamic, and non-corporate atmosphere where adaptability is key
The chance to be part of our exciting global expansion journey
Flexible working hours
Free access to courses, books and Masterminds
Opportunities for professional growth and development


Job Summary:

As a Data Analyst at Happy Mammoth, you’ll be at the heart of our data-driven efforts. Your insights will directly influence our strategies to optimize customer acquisition, retention, and lifetime value. In this role, you’ll dive into customer behavior, analyze marketing performance, and provide actionable insights that drive our direct-response and B2C marketing initiatives.

Responsibilities:


Collect, analyze, and interpret data to uncover trends, patterns, and insights that inform our business strategies
Build, maintain, and automate dashboards and reports to track KPIs, including ROAS, CPA, conversion rates, CLTV, and customer retention metrics
Work closely with cross-functional teams, such as marketing, product, and finance, to provide data-driven insights that support campaign performance and strategic marketing decisions
Provide ad hoc analysis to address specific business questions
Ensure data quality and accuracy by regularly validating and cleansing datasets
Communicate findings effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders through reports, presentations, and storytelling


Qualifications:


Proven experience in data analysis, preferably with a focus on e-commerce
Proficiency in SQL and Excel
Proven experience in data visualization tools (e.g. Looker Data Studio, Looker, Power BI or similar)
Hands-on experience with cloud-based data warehouses and architectures (familiarity with Google BigQuery is a strong asset)
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
Effective communicator with the ability to convey complex data insights clearly


What will set you apart:


You have a genuine hunger for success in all parts of your life
You thrive taking action, taking responsibility and getting things done before deadlines
You’re able to self-manage based upon the overall scope and work required
You’re able to diagnose and solve technical problems quickly
You're able to work as part of a team and actively contribute to conversations
A willingness to learn and grow with the business


CVs should be in English

Powered by JazzHR

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
A Decskill nasceu em 2014 como uma consultoria de outsourcing de IT, com a principal missão de entrega de valor pelo conhecimento. Capacitamos as empresas para os desafios do mundo digital disponibilizando aos nossos clientes, modelos de negócio que permitam assegurar Capacitação Tecnológica, Flexibilidade e Agilidade. Em números, somos 500 consultores com escritórios em Lisboa, Porto e Madrid.


DECSKILL atua em 3 grandes áreas:

• A DECSKILL TALENT, através da qual disponibilizamos ao nosso cliente uma extensão das equipas de IT nas vertentes tecnológicas;

• A DECSKILL BOOST, através da qual disponibilizamos desenvolvimento especializado que permita aumentar a capacidade e otimizar o Time-to-Market, onde criamos e gerimos equipas que entregam de acordo com as suas necessidades, à velocidade desejada;

• A DECSKILL CONNECT através da qual disponibilizamos ao nosso cliente serviços de consultoria, implementação e gestão de infraestruturas de tecnologia de informação.


A nossa prática tem como resultado a criação de valor para os nossos clientes, seja pela entrega de serviços qualificados e de valor acrescentado, seja através de profissionais altamente qualificados e motivados, bem como, pelas soluções tecnológicas que permitem operar e transformar o negócio dos nossos clientes.


Procuramos um Data Analyst para projeto no centro de Lisboa (regime híbrido, 3x/semana em escritório)


Principais responsabilidades:

  • Identificar KPIs relevantes para contar a história do que está acontecendo no negócio;
  • Criar painéis automatizados com uma visualização clara dos dados e realizar a validação dos dados;
  • Implementar e manter pipelines de dados como entradas para os painéis;
  • Estabelecer a governança de dados estabelecendo padrões para a definição e aplicação consistentes de métricas;
  • Projetar uma análise ad hoc inteligente que equilibre as diversas e específicas necessidades de diversos atores empresariais e apoie modelos analíticos para entender o comportamento dos clientes;
  • Parceria com diferentes equipes (por exemplo, Analytics, Marketing, Vendas, Operações, etc.) para produzir insights como consultor de dados internos;
  • Identificar oportunidades estratégicas, áreas de melhoria, melhores práticas e promover melhorias em nossa capacidade;
  • Entregue a tempo e com precisão.


Requisitos:

  • Licenciatura em Licenciatura em Ciências da Computação, Matemática, Engenharia, Estatística, Pesquisa de Operação ou disciplinas quantitativas;
  • Experiência superior a 2 anos em análise de dados, com proficiência em SQL, PL/SQL e Excel;
  • Experiência com Business Intelligence e ferramentas de visualização de dados (ex.: Power BI);
  • Experiência em alavancar dados e análises para resolver problemas do mundo real e criar novas soluções;
  • Conhecimentos em Python e em pipelines de dados (valoridado).


Se a oportunidade corresponde às suas expectativas, envie-nos o seu CV para o email marta.fonseca@decskill.com, com a referência “MF / DAN”.



A Decskill assume um compromisso de igualdade e não discriminação com todos os seus talentos. Recrutamos e promovemos talento com base na diversidade e inclusão, independentemente da idade, gênero, etnia, raça, nacionalidade ou qualquer outra forma de discriminação incompatível com a dignidade da pessoa humana.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Pozuelo de Alarcón, Community of Madrid, Spain
Description:
Verisure is seeking a talented, innovative, passionate Data Analyst to join our growing and successful Group Marketing Team, reporting to the Group Head of Web development & Analytics.

Verisure is building a talented and passionate Digital Marketing Team, and the Data Analyst position is key to its success! This is your chance to visibly impact on Verisure’s growth and the development of a best-in-class organization.

The role’s relevance in data collection and analysis is a great opportunity for a strong talent to develop our organization’s growth. Our success depends on our people, and we invest in them every day. Working with Verisure is being part of an industry leading, world-class company that thrives on a strong entrepreneurial spirit.

Key Responsibilities

As a core member of the Group Digital Marketing team, the Data Analyst will play a crucial role in driving data-informed decision-making by performing the following responsibilities:

Improving the quality and consistency of digital marketing tracking, collaborating with technical teams to maintain a robust data infrastructure and ensure the integrity of analytics data.
Designing, building, and maintaining marketing performance dashboards and reports using Tableau, Looker Studio or similar data visualization tools, ensuring clarity, accuracy, and usability for diverse stakeholders.
Engaging with cross-functional stakeholders to understand business needs, translate them into data requirements, and deliver actionable insights through compelling analysis and visual storytelling.
Partnering with teams across the organization, including Product, CRM, and Web, to identify data opportunities, support campaign measurement, and foster a data-driven culture.
Extracting and manipulating data using SQL to support advanced analytics and reporting needs.
Contributing to the development and lifecycle of Adtech products, including participation in requirement definition, data architecture design, and ongoing maintenance.

Location

The position will be based in Madrid (Spain).

Candidate profile

Qualifications, Experiences, and Competencies

Required Qualifications

Education & Experience

Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, Marketing, or a related field.
Minimum of 2–3 years of experience in data analysis within a digital marketing or Adtech environment.
Experience working in multinational or cross-market teams is a plus.

Technical Skills

Good understanding of digital tracking technologies, including GA4, Google Tag Manager, and custom event tracking.
Solid experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker Studio.
Familiarity with digital marketing platforms (e.g. Google Ads, Meta Ads, DV360, etc.).
Knowledge of marketing KPIs, attribution models, customer journey analysis, and performance measurement.
Proficiency in SQL for data extraction, cleaning, and manipulation across large datasets.
Ability to handle large datasets and navigate data warehouse environments (experience with BigQuery is a plus).
Basic understanding of Python or R for automation and exploratory data analysis is an advantage.

Analytical & Business Acumen

Strong ability to translate business problems into analytical questions and deliver actionable insights.
Working knowledge of conversion funnel analysis, CRO strategies, and campaign optimization.
Experience with A/B testing design, analysis, and interpretation is a plus.

Communication & Collaboration

Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present complex insights clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Proven ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Product, CRM, Design, and Content.
Proactive, detail-oriented, and comfortable working autonomously in a fast-paced environment.

Languages

Fluent English is required (written and spoken).
Other languages (e.g. Spanish, French, German, or Nordic languages) are a plus.

Preferred Qualifications

Experience working with Google BigQuery or similar cloud-based data platforms.
Exposure to Adtech environments, CDPs (Customer Data Platforms), or server-side tracking.
Experience with automated reporting solutions or building data pipelines.
Familiarity with marketing mix modeling, predictive analytics, or machine learning use cases.
Certifications such as:
Google Analytics Certification
Tableau/Power BI certifications
Meta or Google Ads certifications

Strong fit with our Company DNA

Passionate in Everything We Do: Our people have a sense of energy that is unmistakable, one that drives us to delight our customers and focus on creating impact quickly. 

Committed to Making a Difference: When we say we will do something; we deliver with excellence. We are accountable, focused and operate with discipline. 

Always Innovating: We believe that Innovation can be big or small; it’s a continuous state of mind that inspires us to think differently and always make things better. We are risk takers and we learn continuously. 

Winning as a Team: Our people know that by leveraging one another’s strengths, investing in and developing our team’s capability and by collaborating well, we will win.

With Trust & Responsibility: Operating with integrity is core to our success. We are humble, honest and value deep mastery and expertise. We do the right thing, always.

The Company

Verisure is the leading European provider of professionally monitored security systems with 24/7 response services. We protect more than 5 million families and small businesses across 17 countries in Europe and Latin America. And our mission is to provide our customers peace of mind by protecting what matters most to them.

With over 35 years of insight, experience, and innovation, Verisure is known for category-creating marketing, sales excellence, innovative products and services, and customer-centricity. Thanks to a strong focus on high quality, our customers are amongst the most satisfied and loyal in our industry. We have some of the strongest double-digit growth and retention rates globally in consumer-facing services which demonstrates our exceptional service levels and strong value proposition to our customers.

Diversity, inclusion, equity, and belonging at Verisure

At Verisure, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace, recognising that diversity of thought and background only makes our teams stronger and more innovative. We reject all forms of discrimination and bias, and we believe in access to opportunities for everyone, regardless of gender, age, disability status, race, sexual orientation, or any other status. Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Belonging values are embedded in our company’s DNA. And we continue to prioritise our DEIB efforts every day to create a more inclusive organisation, enable diverse representation of our community, and ensure equity and meritocracy every step of the way.
 

Show more
HTML:
Verisure is seeking a talented, innovative, passionate Data Analyst to join our growing and successful Group Marketing Team, reporting to the Group Head of Web development & Analytics.

Verisure is building a talented and passionate Digital Marketing Team, and the Data Analyst position is key to its success! This is your chance to visibly impact on Verisure’s growth and the development of a best-in-class organization.

The role’s relevance in data collection and analysis is a great opportunity for a strong talent to develop our organization’s growth. Our success depends on our people, and we invest in them every day. Working with Verisure is being part of an industry leading, world-class company that thrives on a strong entrepreneurial spirit.

Key Responsibilities

As a core member of the Group Digital Marketing team, the Data Analyst will play a crucial role in driving data-informed decision-making by performing the following responsibilities:

  • Improving the quality and consistency of digital marketing tracking, collaborating with technical teams to maintain a robust data infrastructure and ensure the integrity of analytics data.
  • Designing, building, and maintaining marketing performance dashboards and reports using Tableau, Looker Studio or similar data visualization tools, ensuring clarity, accuracy, and usability for diverse stakeholders.
  • Engaging with cross-functional stakeholders to understand business needs, translate them into data requirements, and deliver actionable insights through compelling analysis and visual storytelling.
  • Partnering with teams across the organization, including Product, CRM, and Web, to identify data opportunities, support campaign measurement, and foster a data-driven culture.
  • Extracting and manipulating data using SQL to support advanced analytics and reporting needs.
  • Contributing to the development and lifecycle of Adtech products, including participation in requirement definition, data architecture design, and ongoing maintenance.

Location

The position will be based in Madrid (Spain).

Candidate profile

Qualifications, Experiences, and Competencies

Required Qualifications

Education & Experience

  • Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, Marketing, or a related field.
  • Minimum of 2–3 years of experience in data analysis within a digital marketing or Adtech environment.
  • Experience working in multinational or cross-market teams is a plus.

Technical Skills

  • Good understanding of digital tracking technologies, including GA4, Google Tag Manager, and custom event tracking.
  • Solid experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker Studio.
  • Familiarity with digital marketing platforms (e.g. Google Ads, Meta Ads, DV360, etc.).
  • Knowledge of marketing KPIs, attribution models, customer journey analysis, and performance measurement.
  • Proficiency in SQL for data extraction, cleaning, and manipulation across large datasets.
  • Ability to handle large datasets and navigate data warehouse environments (experience with BigQuery is a plus).
  • Basic understanding of Python or R for automation and exploratory data analysis is an advantage.

Analytical & Business Acumen

  • Strong ability to translate business problems into analytical questions and deliver actionable insights.
  • Working knowledge of conversion funnel analysis, CRO strategies, and campaign optimization.
  • Experience with A/B testing design, analysis, and interpretation is a plus.

Communication & Collaboration

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present complex insights clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Proven ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Product, CRM, Design, and Content.
  • Proactive, detail-oriented, and comfortable working autonomously in a fast-paced environment.

Languages

  • Fluent English is required (written and spoken).
  • Other languages (e.g. Spanish, French, German, or Nordic languages) are a plus.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience working with Google BigQuery or similar cloud-based data platforms.
  • Exposure to Adtech environments, CDPs (Customer Data Platforms), or server-side tracking.
  • Experience with automated reporting solutions or building data pipelines.
  • Familiarity with marketing mix modeling, predictive analytics, or machine learning use cases.
  • Certifications such as:
    • Google Analytics Certification
    • Tableau/Power BI certifications
    • Meta or Google Ads certifications

Strong fit with our Company DNA

  • Committed to Making a Difference: When we say we will do something; we deliver with excellence. We are accountable, focused and operate with discipline. 

  • Always Innovating: We believe that Innovation can be big or small; it’s a continuous state of mind that inspires us to think differently and always make things better. We are risk takers and we learn continuously. 

  • Winning as a Team: Our people know that by leveraging one another’s strengths, investing in and developing our team’s capability and by collaborating well, we will win.

  • With Trust & Responsibility: Operating with integrity is core to our success. We are humble, honest and value deep mastery and expertise. We do the right thing, always.

The Company

Verisure is the leading European provider of professionally monitored security systems with 24/7 response services. We protect more than 5 million families and small businesses across 17 countries in Europe and Latin America. And our mission is to provide our customers peace of mind by protecting what matters most to them.

With over 35 years of insight, experience, and innovation, Verisure is known for category-creating marketing, sales excellence, innovative products and services, and customer-centricity. Thanks to a strong focus on high quality, our customers are amongst the most satisfied and loyal in our industry. We have some of the strongest double-digit growth and retention rates globally in consumer-facing services which demonstrates our exceptional service levels and strong value proposition to our customers.

Diversity, inclusion, equity, and belonging at Verisure

At Verisure, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace, recognising that diversity of thought and background only makes our teams stronger and more innovative. We reject all forms of discrimination and bias, and we believe in access to opportunities for everyone, regardless of gender, age, disability status, race, sexual orientation, or any other status. Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Belonging values are embedded in our company’s DNA. And we continue to prioritise our DEIB efforts every day to create a more inclusive organisation, enable diverse representation of our community, and ensure equity and meritocracy every step of the way.

Title: Business Data Analyst (H/F)
Description:
We’re looking for the right candidate to join our Business Data Analyst team and become part of a fast-growing company that is on always on the look for people that will demonstrate they’re able to grow with the company. As the role is our entry level, this is a great entry point for a career path at Lokad, either as a future technical expert or as manager.




We help companies in different verticals (aerospace, automotive, ecommerce…) to forecast and make decisions about their inventory. The vast majority of our clients are based outside of France, mainly in North America and Europe.




As a Business Data Analyst (or Supply Chain Scientist in Lokad's terminology), your role is to make sure our clients get the most from Lokad's technology. The role is a mix between technology, data crunching and supply chain expertise. You will address complex supply chain issues and craft quantitative strategies. Your goal is not only to advise your clients on strategies to adopt, but to craft and execute these strategies on a daily basis while leveraging the data available as much as possible. Your goal is also to keep refining these strategies over time to keep them aligned with the needs of our clients.




At Lokad, you will benefit from the extensive training and coaching of our expert team. You will gain skills in supply chain, predictive analysis and overall quantitative optimization for business. You will learn how to achieve measurable business results grounded on scientific analysis of data.




About one quarter of your time is spent interacting with clients in order to better understand their business (mainly over the phone or by mail, with occasional travels). Note that, in order to benefit from your colleagues expertise, you won't be required to work on the customers' premises.




The rest of your time is spent on data analysis, including manipulating and cleaning data, setting up forecasts, economic optimization, reporting and data vizualisation. In order to do this, you'll learn to use our Differentiable Programming tools and a DSL (Envision) developped by Lokad.




We are looking for candidates with the following skills and qualities:




A strong engineering background.
A keen interest in data and quantitative analysis in general.
Good Excel skills or programming skills (e.g. Python, VBA, SQL, etc.).
Impeccable command of English ( French is optional).
Excellent communication skills and telephone manners.
A well-made head, rather than a well-filled head. We are not looking for someone who is already an expert in supply chain or programming. We’re looking for a fast learner, with an ability to quickly grasp technology and concepts, since our technology is by no means a simple and plug-and-play product. Knowledge or understanding of supply chain would be a bonus, but the ability to quickly assess and grasp a new situation or get a clear picture of how an organization works and what are the pain points is what we are really after.
Candidates must be self-motivated, confident and highly driven to achieve results with a “hands on” attitude.




The role is predominantly office based, although some travel will be occasionally required to customers, partners or events. We are located in the very center of Paris, France (station Chevaleret).

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About us:

Fleming was founded with the goal of creating high-quality digital health, wellness, and AI programs globally. We seek to make people's lives happier, healthier, and more productive by creating empowering self-growth products for everyday life. Our team of experts ranges from innovative AI specialists, creative minds, and imaginative designers to professional medical doctors and data scientists, working together as one to help millions of people around the world.




With 1,2+ million customers worldwide, we're providing unique opportunities, attracting talents to join our fast-growing team, and creating innovative brands in a rapidly growing digital health industry. If you think you're bold, ambitious, and not afraid to challenge yourself, let's talk!




We are looking:

We are seeking a Data Analyst with Data Engineering experience to strengthen our data-driven decision-making. You will primarily focus on analyzing data, building reports, and supporting stakeholders with insights, while also contributing to data integration and improving workflows where needed. This is a great opportunity for a mid-level analyst who enjoys working with both data insights and the foundations that make those insights possible.




Get ready to:

Use BigQuery, SQL, and Looker Studio to deliver accurate and timely insights.
Analyze data and create reports that help stakeholders make informed decisions.
Identify and resolve data issues such as quality gaps, discrepancies, and missing values.
Contribute to the improvement of data pipelines and transformations (not necessarily owning them end-to-end).
Apply SQL and data modeling practices to support reporting and analytics.
Assist with data validation and monitoring to ensure reliability of dashboards and reports.
Use R or Python for data analysis, automation, and solving more advanced analytical problems.
Communicate results and recommendations effectively with technical and non-technical teams.
Support colleagues with reporting and analytics tasks, sharing best practices and solutions.




We expect you to:

Have solid SQL skills: ability to join and manipulate different data types, debug code, and optimize queries.
Have experience working with BI/reporting tools (e.g., Looker Studio, Power BI, or Tableau).
Have knowledge or experience working with R or Python for data analysis and automation.
Be familiar with basic data engineering concepts (e.g., ETL/ELT, data modeling, automation), with a willingness to grow these skills further.
Communicate clearly and consistently about progress, challenges, and findings.
Be curious, detail-oriented, and eager to learn.
Be fluent in English and Lithuanian.




Our Benefits & Perks:

Office Location: A peaceful, green workspace in the heart of Antakalnis, Sapiegos Park. Perfect for focus and fresh air.
Parking Compensation: We cover your parking expenses, so you can commute stress-free.
Work-from-Home Flexibility: Hybrid setup, 4 days in the office, 1 day from home. We stay flexible when life happens.
Pet-Friendly Office: Bring your furry friend to work.
Work Tools: We’ll set you up with a MacBook and all the tools you need to do your work.
Grow Your Skills: We believe in learning and growth. If you need extra training or courses to level up, we’re here to support you.
Daily Meals: Lunch is prepared in the office every day. On Fridays, we mix it up, sometimes we head out to San Diego Pub, other times we order in pizza, sushi, or other.
Snacks & Refreshments: Unlimited drinks, snacks, fresh fruits, and veggies.
Team Events: team buildings, summer/winter events, and activities to keep the vibes going.
Birthday Surprise: We celebrate your birthday with a gift.
Referral Bonus Program: Know someone awesome? Get rewarded for helping us grow.




Salary

Gross salary range is 3500-5000 EUR/month.

*Salary is negotiable depending on experience.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
For 30 years, the incredible minds at Cognyte around the world have worked closely together and put their expertise to work to keep up with constantly evolving technological and criminal trends, and help make the world a safer place with leading investigative analytics software solutions.

We are defined by our dedication to doing good, and this translates to business success, meaningful work friendships, a can-do attitude, and deep curiosity.

As a Cognyter you will:

Analyze large and complex datasets across departments (Sales, Marketing, Customer Success, etc.) to identify trends, issues, and actionable insights
Translate business needs into structured data analysis, delivering impactful dashboards, reports, and recommendations
Support strategic decision-making through business intelligence tools and data storytelling
Partner with cross-functional teams to drive data-driven initiatives across the organization
Collaborate with IT and GTM teams to evaluate current Salesforce (SFDC) usage, identify workflow gaps, and enhance CRM-related processes
Help design, document, and implement improvements in Salesforce to increase efficiency, automation, and data integrity
Act as a bridge between business and technical teams to ensure CRM updates meet operational needs
Maintain high data quality and governance standards within Salesforce
Provide user training and support change management for Salesforce process updates




For that mission, you’ll need:

3+ years of experience in a data analyst role with a strong focus on data-driven insights and CRM optimization
Hands-on experience with Salesforce (SFDC), including workflows, reports, dashboards, and data governance
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with proficiency in Excel, SQL, and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI)
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to collaborate with both technical and business stakeholders
High attention to detail and a passion for turning data into meaningful business outcomes
Fluent English (spoken and written); additional languages – an advantage
Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or similar); advanced degree – an advantage







Remember: When you're curious enough, you don't need to check every box to apply. Be in touch!

We believe that diverse teams drive the greatness of ideas, products, and companies. Whatever your gender, age, race, creed, or taste in music – if you're curious enough, we’re waiting for you. Apply now.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst Trainee
HTML:
Arcaplanet consolida la sua leadership e la sua strategia di crescita con l’apertura di decine di nuovi punti vendita ogni anno su tutto il territorio nazionale, con lo sviluppo del canale on line e di tutte le formule digitali in logica omnichannel integrata e con lo sviluppo dell’offerta di nuovi servizi dedicati ai Pet.

A supporto di tale strategia e con un forte orientamento customer centric, investe nello sviluppo delle professionalità che operano sia nel Retail che nell’Headquarter con l’obiettivo costante di garantire la massima soddisfazione ed un servizio di eccellenza.

All’interno del team Data & Analytics, con l’obiettivo di affiancare un Senior Data Analyst nelle attività quotidiane di raccolta, analisi e interpretazione dei dati provenienti da diverse fonti aziendali, digitali e offline.


In questo contesto di riferimento, cerchiamo un/una:

Data Analyst Trainee


Principali Responsabilità:

  • Supporterai il team nell’analisi dei dati web e digitali (es. traffico, conversioni, funnel, ecc.);
  • Scriverai e ottimizzerai query SQL per l’estrazione dei dati da database relazionali e/o BigQuery;
  • Collaborerai alla creazione di dashboard e report con Power BI;
  • Eseguirai analisi ad hoc a supporto di team eCommerce, CRM e omnicanalità;
  • Utilizzerai Excel per pulizia dati, analisi preliminari e costruzione di modelli di sintesi;
  • Documenterai processi analitici e contribuirai al miglioramento continuo delle attività di data governance.


Requisiti:

  • Laurea triennale o magistrale (anche in corso) in ambito quantitativo: Statistica, Informatica, Ingegneria, Economia o simili;
  • Conoscenza di base di SQL (preferibile esperienza su database come MySQL, BigQuery, DataBriks ecc.);
  • Conoscenza dei principali strumenti di Web Analytics (es. Google Analytics 4, Google Tag Manager);
  • Buona padronanza di Excel (tabelle pivot, formule, funzioni avanzate);
  • Familiarità con strumenti di data visualization, preferibilmente Power BI;
  • Spirito analitico, precisione e voglia di imparare;
  • Capacità di lavorare in team e gestione del tempo;
  • Conoscenza dell’inglese a livello base/intermedio (capacità di comprendere documentazione tecnica e comunicare efficacemente in ambito lavorativo).


Cosa ti offriamo?

  • L’inserimento in un’azienda leader, dinamica, rapida e in forte crescita nell’ambito di un mercato in continua evoluzione e con margini di sviluppo importanti anche nello scenario internazionale;
  • Un ambiente di lavoro giovane, agile e improntato a valorizzazione del merito e del talento;
  • Un percorso di stage extracurriculare e formazione on the job;
  • Assunzione con stage extracurriculare, rimborso spese 800 euro.


Sede di lavoro: Headquarter di Milano

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
NTT Data somos todas las personas que la formamos. Un equipo de más de 139.000 profesionales, tan diverso cómo diversos son los 50 países en los que estamos presentes y los diferentes sectores en los que desarrollamos nuestra actividad; telecomunicaciones, entidades financieras, industria, utilities, energía, administración pública y sanidad.

¿Nuestra misión? Ofrecer soluciones tecnológicas, de negocio, estrategia, desarrollo y mantenimiento de aplicaciones, siendo un referente en consultoría. Todo gracias a la colaboración entre equipos, la calidad humana de nuestra gente y a que no nos conformamos con lo establecido, buscamos siempre la innovación que nos acerca al futuro.

Nuestra esencia nos ha llevado a la vanguardia de la tecnología, a romper paradigmas y a brindar las soluciones que realmente se corresponden a las necesidades de cada cliente. Nuestro talento nos ha hecho poder decir con orgullo que somos una de las 6 empresas TOP de tecnologías en el mundo. Porque #Greattech, needs #GreatPeople, like you.




¿Cuál será tu rol?

Estamos buscando Analistas de Datos con experiencia de más de 4 años en Ingestas de datos, con el objetivo de diseñar, desarrollar y mantener los procesos que traen datos desde las posibles fuentes hacia el sistema de almacenamiento.




Experiencia necesaria en:

Lenguaje de programación Python: programación orientada a objetos.
Testing con Pytest o similar.
Framework PySpark (tratamiento de datos, optimización de procesos).
CI/CD (Integración Continua) y versionado de código (Git, Bitbucket, Artifactory).
Análisis y diseño de Software (diagramas UML y patrones de diseño).
Cloud AWS.




¿Qué esperamos de ti?

Ganas de desarrollarte en una compañía líder en servicios de consultoría IT
Fuertes habilidades comunicativas con interlocutores senior y Top Management.
Proactividad y autonomía
Flexibilidad y habilidad para trabajar en entornos de presión.
Orientación al desempeño de calidad.
Pensamiento analítico y conceptual.
Trabajo colaborativo y efectivo en una dinámica de grupo, a menudo virtual.
Resolución de problemas, capacidad de estructurar y definir análisis para sacar conclusiones.




¿Qué te ofrecemos?

Si aún te estás pensando si NTT Data es tu sitio, si pasas a formar parte del equipo te ofrecemos:

Estabilidad laboral, mediante un contrato indefinido
Retribución competitiva y revisiones anuales.
Facilidad de conciliación de tu vida personal y laboral, gracias a la flexibilidad horaria.
Beneficios sociales (Guardería Seguro Médico descuentos en productos y servicios entre otras opciones)
Entorno de aprendizaje en una empresa con una cultura orientada a las personas




En NTT Data creemos que toda persona es única y diferente y por ello apostamos por una cultura inclusiva que reconoce y valora la diversidad.

Trabajamos día a día para crear un entorno en el que podamos explorar, vivir y potenciar nuestra propia singularidad.

#WeAreAllUnique #YouMakeUsUnique

Un equipo de más de 139.000 profesionales, tan diverso cómo diversos son los 50 países en los que estamos presentes y los diferentes sectores en los que desarrollamos nuestra actividad; telecomunicaciones, entidades financieras, industria, utilities, energía, administración pública y sanidad.

¿Nuestra misión? Ofrecer soluciones tecnológicas, de negocio, estrategia, desarrollo y mantenimiento de aplicaciones, siendo un referente en consultoría. Todo gracias a la colaboración entre equipos, la calidad humana de nuestra gente y a que no nos conformamos con lo establecido, buscamos siempre la innovación que nos acerca al futuro.

Nuestra esencia nos ha llevado a la vanguardia de la tecnología, a romper paradigmas y a brindar las soluciones que realmente se corresponden a las necesidades de cada cliente. Nuestro talento nos ha hecho poder decir con orgullo que somos una de las 6 empresas TOP de tecnologías en el mundo. Porque #Greattech, needs #GreatPeople, like you.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
CHI SIAMO?




IDATA GROUP è un System Integrator, nato nel 1979 e da oltre 40 anni lavora a supporto delle aziende in Italia e all’ Estero.

Grazie alle competenze acquisite negli anni, offriamo servizi di:

Sviluppo software, web, mobile, embedded, IOT
Cloud
Cybersecurity: PT, WAPT, VA, Digital Identity, DLP, Data Protection, Governance, Corporate Security
Data Analysis e Data Engineering
Business Intelligence
Sistemi GIS
Project Management e Integrazione di sistemi Innovativi







CHE RUOLO TI PROPONIAMO?




Data Analyst




Sei alla ricerca di un team dove poter condividere le tue idee, crescere professionalmente e mettere in pratica la tua passione per l'analisi dei dati e la Business Intelligence?

Perfetto, sei nel posto giusto!

Lavorando con noi come Data Analyst, collaborerai con un team che segue progetti internazionali e innovativi, proponendo e realizzando soluzioni di Business Intelligence con diversi strumenti, tra cui Power BI, QlikView, QlikSense e altri tool di analisi.







COSA CERCHIAMO IN TE?




Laurea in Ingegneria Informatica, Ingegneria Gestionale, Informatica o affini
Conoscenza degli strumenti per la manipolazione, visualizzazione e analisi dei dati
Almeno 1-2 anni di esperienza pregressa con Power BI, Qlik Sense o Qlik View
Capacità di lavorare con database e linguaggi di programmazione come SQL, DAX, Python
Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese







DOVE LAVORERAI?




La sede di lavoro è Milano, con la possibilità di lavorare in modalità ibrida.







COSA PROPONE IL TEAM IDATA?




Contratto e Benefit: inserimento immediato con contratto CCNL Commercio e Servizi del Terziario;

Benefit: ticket restaurant e assicurazione sanitaria integrativa

Lavorerai con: PC Aziendale

Si lavora dal lunedì al venerdì, full time 40 ore settimanali, dalle 9 alle 18 (orario indicativo).

L’inquadramento economico verrà valutato dalla azienda a seconda delle esperienze maturate

Title: Analista de datos BI
Place: Pozuelo de Alarcón, Community of Madrid, Spain
Description:
¡Dale un aire nuevo a tu vida y sigue creciendo en tu carrera dentro de SECURITAS DIRECT!

¿Quiénes somos?
Somos líderes en el mercado europeo de la protección y seguridad de personas para hogares y pequeños negocios, aportando un servicio excepcional a más de 3 millones de clientes/as con un equipo de más de 25.000 empleados, presentes en 17 países de Europa y América Latina. En Securitas Direct hemos creado las innovaciones más disruptivas del mercado, las cuales se han convertido en estándar para la industria y el sector. Combinamos la pasión, el compromiso, el compañerismo y la responsabilidad en nuestro día a día teniendo como foco principal el cuidado de nuestros clientes.

El departamento de Subdirección general de captación

Desde la subdirección general de captación, estamos buscando al mejor talento para incorporarse en nuestros equipos de negocio. En esta departamento trabajan 3 equipos con más de 20 profesionales liderando proyectos que impulsen la estrategia comercial de la empresa y la toma de decisiones a través del análisis de datos.

¿Quieres ser parte de nuestro crecimiento?

Reportando directamente al Head of del área de Business Intelligence dentro tu misión como Analista de Datos BI será el ayudar al cliente interno a la mejora de toma de decisiones  ayudando a identificar el problema de negocio y desarrollando la solución más adecuada, a través de la analitica del dato.

Responsabilidades en tu día a día

Automatización de Informes mediante la creación de Dashboards.

Estudios ad-hoc sobre el DWH Coorporativo para la ayuda de seguimientos de proyectos:

Análisis & Creación de KPIs de Negocio.

Prospección y análisis de nuevas variables.

Creación de Dashboards de seguimiento.

Entendimiento de procesos de Negocio, para una posterior creación de la lógica mediante procedimientos en SQL y así la obtención de los KPis de seguimiento.

Automatismos de Procesos de BI vía procesos en Python.

Requisitos de la posición

Titulación universitaria superior: Ingeniería Informática, Matemáticas, Estadística o similar. 

Experiencia mínima de 3 años como consultor en proyectos de BI y Reporting, o en funciones similares que capaciten al candidato/a en el desarrollo de las funciones indicadas.

Dominio leguaje SQL y experiencia con BBDD (Snowflake, Sybase, SQL Server,…).

Experiencia con herramientas de Reporting sobre todo Power BI. Valorable Business Objects.

Conocimientos de herramientas Open Source (Python, R,…) .

Valorable Conocimientos de Hyperion.

Clara Orientación al Cliente.

Persona proactiva, analítica y con buena capacidad de comunicación.

Requisitos valorables:

Creación de Modelos Estadisticos de Optimización o de Segmentación.

Conocimiento en otras herramientas de reporting similares (Microstrategy, Qlik, Tableau,... ).

Conocimientos en herramientas de ETL.

Conocimientos de Gestión de Proyectos con IT.

¿Qué te ofrecemos?

Modelo híbrido de teletrabajo (16 días de teletrabajo al trimestre) para que los adaptes a tus necesidades.

Horario flexible de entrada/salida y jornada intensiva los viernes.

22 días de vacaciones al año + 1 día de asuntos propios + bolsa de horas de exceso.

La tarde de tu cumpleaños ¡Libre!

Plan de carrera personalizado anual.

Comedor subvencionado, contamos con 3 restaurantes dentro de nuestra oficina por lo que ¡Olvídate de Tuppers!

Descuentos en productos propios.

Retribución flexible.

Apoyo a la maternidad, paternidad, políticas de igualdad y diversidad.

¿Y que hay acerca de la formación?
Serás el/la protagonista de tu ruta de aprendizaje, por lo que contarás con miles de recursos para seguir impulsando tu conocimiento técnico.

Más de 100h en formación en idiomas.

¡Tú eres protagonista de tu desarrollo! Tendrás la oportunidad de desarrollar un catálogo formativo adhoc adaptado a tu perfil profesional.

¿Y ahora qué?
Si has llegado hasta aquí es porque realmente te hemos parecido interesantes. Cómo próximos pasos, apúntate en nuestra oferta y el equipo de gestión de personas revisará tu perfil. Si encajas con la necesidad, te llamaremos para poder conocerte y darte más información acerca de la posición y de nosotros.

Como último consejo: ¡Se tú mismo/a!

¡Estamos deseando conocerte!

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Business Intelligence Analyst – Logistikbranche

Standort: Remote




Ihre Aufgaben:

Analyse bestehender Datenstrukturen und Entwicklung von Strategien zur Leistungs- und Effizienzoptimierung
Erstellung datengetriebener Lösungen und Visualisierung von Erkenntnissen in Power BI-Dashboards
Enge Zusammenarbeit mit Data Engineers und Fachabteilungen zur kontinuierlichen Verbesserung datenbasierter Prozesse
Mitwirkung an strategischen Projekten und Entwicklung moderner BI-Architekturen in der Azure Cloud




Ihr Profil:

Mindestens 3 Jahre nachweisbare Berufserfahrung im Bereich Business Intelligence oder Data Engineering
Idealerweise Kenntnisse in Power BI (DAX), Azure und SQL
Mehrjährige Erfahrung in der Datenmodellierung und Implementierung effizienter Datenpipelines
Erfahrung in der Entwicklung von Power BI-Dashboards und der Optimierung bestehender Berichte
Fließende Deutsch und Englischkenntnisse

Title: Insights & AI Analyst
Description:
1GLOBAL is a technology-driven global mobile communications provider dedicated to empowering enterprises worldwide to unlock the full growth potential of mobile connectivity. With a best-in-class telecom technology platform, a comprehensive suite of globally viable regulatory licenses, and privileged access to the telecom wholesale market, 1GLOBAL is uniquely positioned to deliver seamless compliance and connectivity solutions. Serving the world's leading banks, corporations, and digital-first businesses—including neo-banks, travel companies, and payment service providers—1GLOBAL connects over 43 million devices globally.

 
With 2024 full-year revenue exceeding US$100 million, 1GLOBAL is a profitable business generating significant cash flows to fund its ongoing investments in infrastructure, transformation, and growth. 2024 saw major client wins and marked 1GLOBAL's evolution from a multi-market telecommunication provider to a global technology-driven mobile connectivity powerhouse.

 
Established in 2022 by experienced tech founders and entrepreneurs Hakan Koç and Pyrros Koussios, 1GLOBAL is a European technology leader driving digital transformation in the global telecommunications market. It operates as a fully regulated Mobile Virtual Network Operator ("MVNO") in nine countries and as a regulated telecommunications operator in an additional 31 countries. Headquartered in the Netherlands, with world-class R&D hubs in Lisbon, Berlin, and São Paulo, 1GLOBAL employs over 450 experts across 13 countries.

Position Overview

We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Insights & AI Analyst to join our data team. The Insights & AI Analyst will be responsible for leveraging data to drive business decision-making, producing insightful reports, and creating engaging visualisations. As 1GLOBAL is embarking in the journey of deploying AI tools to support its day-to-day operations the Insights & AI Analyst will work closely with our Data Architects and AI specialists from our technology teams to ensure that our AI models are feed with high quality data and that meaningful conclusions can be derived from them. This role requires a combination of analytical thinking and a strong ability to communicate complex data in a simple, actionable format. The Insights & AI Analyst, reporting to the Finance Director, will work with multiple teams within the company, turning raw data into meaningful insights to support key business objectives and monitor the effectiveness of our go-to-market strategies as well as driving our AI models.


Key Responsibilities

Data Querying, Predictive and Statistical Analysis

Query large datasets to extract meaningful insights, using tools such as SQL, Python, R, BigQuery, dbt, and business intelligence platforms
Analyse and derive insight from large datasets from telecom systems, including customer usage, network performance, billing, and service data
Apply predictive modelling and machine learning techniques to analyse customer behaviour, such as, identifying potential churn risks, and suggesting retention strategies.


Reporting & Visualisation

Create compelling, visual dashboards and reports using BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Domo, Looker) to communicate insights clearly and effectively to stakeholders
Present complex findings in a user-friendly and visually engaging manner.


Business Insights & Strategy Support:

Engage with internal stakeholders across departments to understand business needs and translate those into analytical projects
Support the development of business strategies by analysing data on customer behaviour, network and wholesale trends, and operational performance
Support our commercial and sales teams to optimise pricing and commercial strategy to maximise revenue, gross profit and win rates.


Data Handling and AI:

Work closely with the data team to ensure that data is properly cleaned and structured, while also having the autonomy to adjust data for analysis purposes when needed
Be a champion for AI within the business by bringing knowledge of recent and relevant AI tools that can be used to generate insight and create operational efficiencies
Work closely with our data architects and AI experts from our engineering team to introduce AI in the day-to-day operations of the business.




Requirements



Must Have

Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Business Analytics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field
Familiarity with machine learning frameworks and statistical models
Experience with LLMs
High SQL & Excel proficiency, understanding of data lineage and quality
Substantial experience with Looker/Tableau or similar, Data Tooling (BigQuery, dbt), Excel/GoogleSheets and Salesforce.​
Effective stakeholder management & communication skills to engage cross-functional team and senior leadership
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to think analytically
A passion for optimising and automating. ​


Nice to Have

Certifications in Data Science, AI, BI Tools, or Machine Learning



Benefits



Why 1GLOBAL?

Growth Opportunities: Advance your career in one of the fastest growing telecommunications companies, expanding over 40% year-on-year under the leadership of successful tech entrepreneurs
Major Transaction Exposure: Be in the driver's seat for transactions that will have an impact on the future telco industry
Work with a Talented Team: From the Board and the Founders to the Senior Management Team, you will collaborate daily with the most capable and renowned external advisors, and constantly being exposed to talented and driven individuals
Dynamic Work Environment: Thrive in a collaborative, fast-paced workplace where innovation is encouraged, and every contribution counts
Professional Development: Work alongside industry experts to enhance your skills and knowledge in a cutting-edge field
International Experience: Gain opportunities to work in different 1GLOBAL offices around the world as you grow within the company
Open Communication Culture: Join a team where your ideas are heard, and open dialogue is encouraged, fostering a supportive and transparent work environment
Get Things Done Attitude: Be part of a results-driven team that values efficiency, creativity, and the drive to make a tangible impact in the industry


1GLOBAL is an equal opportunity employer, we value your character as much as your talent. Diversity drives our innovation, and we offer a collaborative, dynamic, and international work environment. We are excited for you to join our mission to revolutionise connectivity globally.

  • Apply predictive modelling and machine learning techniques to analyse customer behaviour, such as, identifying potential churn risks, and suggesting retention strategies.

Reporting & Visualisation

  • Create compelling, visual dashboards and reports using BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Domo, Looker) to communicate insights clearly and effectively to stakeholders
  • Present complex findings in a user-friendly and visually engaging manner.

Business Insights & Strategy Support:

  • Engage with internal stakeholders across departments to understand business needs and translate those into analytical projects
  • Support the development of business strategies by analysing data on customer behaviour, network and wholesale trends, and operational performance
  • Support our commercial and sales teams to optimise pricing and commercial strategy to maximise revenue, gross profit and win rates.

Data Handling and AI:

  • Work closely with the data team to ensure that data is properly cleaned and structured, while also having the autonomy to adjust data for analysis purposes when needed
  • Be a champion for AI within the business by bringing knowledge of recent and relevant AI tools that can be used to generate insight and create operational efficiencies
  • Work closely with our data architects and AI experts from our engineering team to introduce AI in the day-to-day operations of the business.


Requirements

Must Have

  • Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Business Analytics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field
  • Familiarity with machine learning frameworks and statistical models
  • Experience with LLMs
  • High SQL & Excel proficiency, understanding of data lineage and quality
  • Substantial experience with Looker/Tableau or similar, Data Tooling (BigQuery, dbt), Excel/GoogleSheets and Salesforce.​
  • Effective stakeholder management & communication skills to engage cross-functional team and senior leadership
  • Strong problem-solving skills and ability to think analytically
  • A passion for optimising and automating. ​


Nice to Have

  • Certifications in Data Science, AI, BI Tools, or Machine Learning


Benefits

Why 1GLOBAL?

  • Growth Opportunities: Advance your career in one of the fastest growing telecommunications companies, expanding over 40% year-on-year under the leadership of successful tech entrepreneurs
  • Major Transaction Exposure: Be in the driver's seat for transactions that will have an impact on the future telco industry
  • Work with a Talented Team: From the Board and the Founders to the Senior Management Team, you will collaborate daily with the most capable and renowned external advisors, and constantly being exposed to talented and driven individuals
  • Dynamic Work Environment: Thrive in a collaborative, fast-paced workplace where innovation is encouraged, and every contribution counts
  • Professional Development: Work alongside industry experts to enhance your skills and knowledge in a cutting-edge field
  • International Experience: Gain opportunities to work in different 1GLOBAL offices around the world as you grow within the company
  • Open Communication Culture: Join a team where your ideas are heard, and open dialogue is encouraged, fostering a supportive and transparent work environment
  • Get Things Done Attitude: Be part of a results-driven team that values efficiency, creativity, and the drive to make a tangible impact in the industry


1GLOBAL is an equal opportunity employer, we value your character as much as your talent. Diversity drives our innovation, and we offer a collaborative, dynamic, and international work environment. We are excited for you to join our mission to revolutionise connectivity globally.

Title: Data Analyst en el área de Excelencia Comercial
Place: Tres Cantos, Community of Madrid, Spain
Description:
Hazlo posible. Inspira. Mira hacia el futuro.

¿Te apasiona la educación, las ideas que transforman y los equipos que hacen que las cosas sucedan? Esta es una oportunidad para unirte a una organización líder en soluciones educativas con presencia internacional y fuerte impacto local. Buscamos personas con propósito, comprometidas con la innovación, el trabajo colaborativo y la mejora continua de la educación.




💡 ¿Qué harás en este rol?

Como Analista de Datos de Excelencia Comercial, formarás parte de un equipo dinámico y multidisciplinar, participando en proyectos creativos, colaborativos y con impacto real en el negocio. Tus principales responsabilidades serán:

Elaborar informes estratégicos y operativos a partir de datos internos y externos, utilizando herramientas como Excel avanzado, Power BI y SQL.
Automatizar procesos de análisis y reporting, identificando áreas de mejora y proponiendo recomendaciones basadas en datos.
Colaborar en la elaboración de presupuestos y previsiones comerciales, mediante análisis cuantitativos, simulaciones y validación de hipótesis.
Analizar el rendimiento de campañas y acciones comerciales, interpretando datos del CRM y otras fuentes internas para proponer acciones de mejora.
Participar en proyectos estratégicos multidisciplinares, aportando análisis de datos y perspectivas de mercado.
Apoyar en estudios de segmentación de mercado, pricing, benchmarking y análisis de campañas.
Identificar y monitorear los KPIs clave del área comercial y asegurar su trazabilidad y fiabilidad.




🧠 ¿Qué esperamos de ti?

Buscamos a una persona con experiencia de al menos 3 años desempeñando y asumiendo responsabilidades similares que sea analítica, proactiva y orientada al negocio, capaz de transformar datos en decisiones comerciales, que combine conocimientos técnicos con una actitud resolutiva, colaborativa y enfocada en la mejora continua.




Formación y conocimientos técnicos:

Contar con formación universitaria en Economía, ADE, Marketing, Estadística, Ingeniería o titulaciones afines.
Manejar con soltura Excel avanzado y herramientas de visualización de datos como Power BI o Tableau, para generar informes claros y accionables; se valorará positivamente el conocimiento de SQL para el tratamiento y explotación de datos estructurados.
Trabajar cómodamente con grandes volúmenes de datos, detectando patrones, tendencias y oportunidades de mejora.
Imprescindible nivel avanzado de inglés, con uso diario en la comunicación profesional.




Actitudes y competencias clave:

Aplicar pensamiento analítico y crítico para comprender el negocio más allá de los datos y aportar recomendaciones relevantes.
Asegurar el rigor y la calidad de los análisis, prestando atención al detalle en todas las fases del proceso.
Comunicar conclusiones de forma clara, estructurada y comprensible para audiencias no técnicas, generando impacto real en la toma de decisiones.
Actuar con iniciativa y orientación a resultados, proponiendo mejoras, automatizando procesos y anticipando necesidades del área comercial.
Colaborar eficazmente en equipos multidisciplinares, entendiendo el análisis como una herramienta de apoyo transversal al negocio.




En resumen, esperamos que sea capaz de traducir datos en decisiones, impulsar mejoras a partir del análisis y aportar una mirada crítica que acompañe el crecimiento del área comercial desde la excelencia.




💚 ¿Qué te ofrecemos?

Oportunidad de crecimiento en una empresa innovadora en tecnología educativa.

Modelo de trabajo híbrido: 2 días de oficina y 3 en remoto.

Ubicación: Madrid, Tres Cantos

Formación continua y desarrollo profesional.

Entorno de trabajo colaborativo y dinámico

Show more
