Title: Junior Analyst
HTML:
As part of our team, you will leverage your excel and SQL background to address diverse data-related tasks that demand creative approaches and proficiency in cloud-centric implementations.


You will implement full end-to-end projects and be an integral part of our Center of Excellence (CoE).


More specifically, you will be expected to:


Partner with business key-users and Global Anaplan Solution Architects to design, develop, test, and implement Anaplan solutions in the mining/smelting industry;

Lead regional Anaplan projects by collaborating with business teams to gather local business requirements and develop user stories;

Understand, convert and improve Excel based planning and budgeting into dynamic connected Anaplan models;

Train new users on the system and document processes;

Develop test cases and assist in UAT on the technical and functional acceptance;

Manage multiple stakeholders across various business functions;

Perform root cause analyses and propose solutions;

Articulate design and documentation for Anaplan models (process map, user guide, solution design document);

Effectively identify various dimensions, lists, hierarchies and line items, thereby creating a user-friendly and optimized solution;

Create Hub-Spoke & ALM structure along with user experience pages using the Anaplan New User Experience;

Closely follow Anaplan model building best practices;

Detailed understanding & working experience on Anaplan integration (Cloudworks, Anaplan Connect or other ETL tools) is a definite asset;

Understanding & working experience on PlanIQ, Optimizer, Reporting pages, Polaris, Workflow management, etc. is an asset.



Do you have what it takes?


Bachelor's or graduate's degree in Mathematics, Physics, Enginnerings or economics;

Excel Proficiency: Strong Excel skills are a solid foundation for data manipulation and analysis, which are essential in Anaplan modeling (Visual Basic / macros not required)

Demonstrated ability to optimize;

Good understanding of planning budgeting & forecasting;

Understanding of the mining / concentrating / smelting industry is an asset;

Ability to collaborate effectively and work as part of a global team;

Strong attention to detail and a positive attitude;

Critical thinking and analytical problem-solving skills.


Language : As you will be part of a global team, you must be able to communicate fluently in English (verbal and written). Knowledge of other languages such as French, German and/or Spanish is desirable.


Travel: Some occasional travelling will be required.


Wondering what’s in it for you?

📲 Be part of a world class organization with a mandate to identify opportunities for improvement, leveraging tools such as automation, mobility and AI to drive performance benefits

💰 Very competitive compensation structure

👨 👩 👧 👦 Health Insurance coverage for you and your dependents (employee + spouse/partner and children)

🏥 Life Insurance

📈 Growth opportunities (career progression, tuition assistance, language courses, training and certifications, etc.)


We are building a multi-cultural and multi-disciplinary dream team in which you will have the opportunity to collaborate with domain experts - enjoying all the perks of a big company but with the energy of a start-up.😊

Title: Junior BI Analyst
Description:
Overview: The position of Junior BI Analyst is an entry-level role. The role will include managing ad-hoc reporting/visualization tasks for production, sales, client reporting and more functions in the company.




Description:

Design & implement reports, dashboards, and visualizations using data visualization business intelligence tools
Optimize reporting dashboards with a focus on user experience, performance, flexibility, testability, and standardization
Working closely with stakeholders to understand requirements and provide the best possible solution
Make complex concepts simple and easy to understand by those around you through effective communication, planning and strategic execution
Maintain documentation for design, development and reporting work
Work within our systems and with BI team members to achieve high standards of data integrity, ensuring supporting metrics are accurate and complete
Working within team processes, data governance and security frameworks




Required Skills:

At least 1 year of experience working in a BI environment
Experience using Business Intelligence tools, such as Tableau or PowerBI
Experience in creating interactive dashboards
Minimum Bachelor’s degree or equivalent / in the process of completing those studies.
Ability to learn new skills quickly
Ability to maintain professionalism, focus and result-orientation under pressure and tight deadlines
Attention to detail
Excellent communication skills (both written and verbal) in English
Exceptional problem-solving/critical thinking skills
Experience working in a corporate environment




Desired Skills:

Exposure to Knime, Request Tracker (RT), Snowflake
Prior translation industry experience
Understanding of relational databases
Fluency in a foreign language







By applying, I confirm I have read and accept TransPerfect's Privacy Policy: https://www.transperfect.com/about/data-privacy-recruiting

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Make an impact by working for sectors where technology is the enabler, everything is ground-breaking and there’s a constant need to be innovative.

Be part of the team that combines business knowledge, technological edge and a design experience. Our different backgrounds and know-how are key in developing solutions and experiences for digital clients.

Face challenges and learn other ways of thinking and seeing the world - there’s always room for your energy and creativity.

About The Role

Data Analyst is responsible for examining and interpreting complex data sets to derive meaningful insights and support business decision-making. Focused on descriptive and diagnostic analytics to answer questions of where your company has been, where it is now, why things are the way they are now, and support the decision about what are the next steps.

Their mission involves organizing data, conducting statistical analysis, creating data models, and collecting data requirements from Businesses.

Data analysts collaborate with different teams to understand their analytical requirements, identify key metrics, and communicate data-driven findings to stakeholders effectively.

As a part of your job, you will:


Gathering and analyzing business requirements to determine the best solution for data reporting and analysis;
Designing data solutions such as data warehousing, data marts, dashboards, and reporting systems;
Developing and maintaining data models, reports, and visualizations;
Collaborating with IT teams to ensure proper data integration and management;
Assisting stakeholders in interpreting data insights and making informed business decisions.



What are we looking for?


Proficiency in SQL for data querying and analysis;
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, or matplotlib);
Knowledge of statistical analysis techniques and tools (e.g., R, Python libraries like pandas);
Ability to interpret and analyze complex data sets;
Familiarity with data cleansing and preparation techniques.



Personal traits:

Ability to adapt to different contexts, teams and Clients

Teamwork skills but also sense of autonomy

Motivation for international projects and ok if travel is included

Willingness to collaborate with other players

Strong communication skills

At Celfocus, we are committed to cultivate a diverse and inclusive workplace. As an equal-opportunity employer, we welcome applicants of all backgrounds, gender identities, and abilities. We are dedicated to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with specific needs. If you require any adjustments during the selection process, please inform our Talent Acquisition Team.

Come join the Team!

Celfocus is a European high-tech system integrator, providing leading edge professional services focused on creating business value through Analytics and Cognitive solutions – addressing Telecommunications, Financial Services, Retail, Energy & Utilities, Pharmaceutical, and other markets' strategic opportunities.

As a highly specialised engineering company, Celfocus helps clients undergo their innovation path, providing technological solutions to extract value from data and make it actionable.

Serving clients in +25 countries, Celfocus delivers solutions that boost customer experience and enhance operational efficiency, via our Cognitive Automation, Data & Analytics and Digital offers.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

CCP Global, is the global association for Central Counterparties (CCPs), representing 43 members operating more than 60 CCPs globally across the Americas, EMEA, and the Asia-Pacific region. The organization promotes effective, practical, and appropriate risk management and operational standards to ensure the safety and efficiency of the financial markets it represents.




Role Description

This is a full-time role for a Data Analyst located on-site in the Amsterdam Area. The Data Analyst will be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data to provide insights and support decision-making processes. Daily tasks include performing data modeling, conducting statistical analyses, and preparing detailed reports. Additional responsibilities include communicating findings to stakeholders and collaborating with other departments to support organizational goals.




Qualifications

Strong Analytical Skills and Data Analytics experience
Proficiency in Statistics and Data Modeling techniques
Excellent Communication skills for presenting analytical insights
Attention to detail and problem-solving skills
Ability to work independently and in a team environment
Experience in the financial industry is a plus
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Data Science, Statistics, Economics, or related field

Qualifications

  • Strong Analytical Skills and Data Analytics experience
  • Proficiency in Statistics and Data Modeling techniques
  • Excellent Communication skills for presenting analytical insights
  • Attention to detail and problem-solving skills
  • Ability to work independently and in a team environment
  • Experience in the financial industry is a plus
  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Data Science, Statistics, Economics, or related field

Title: Data & BI Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a Data & Business Intelligence Analyst on a contract basis to support ongoing reporting, dashboard development, and data-cleaning initiatives. This role will help relieve backlog in our analytics pipeline, assist with data validation, and accelerate delivery of dashboards and recurring reports. The ideal candidate is detail-oriented, data-curious, and comfortable with common BI tools and SQL.

Your future duties and responsibilities


Support the creation and maintenance of Power BI or Tableau dashboards
Perform data cleaning, transformation, and validation across key datasets
Write SQL queries for extracting and analyzing data
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand reporting requirements
Automate and streamline recurring Excel or BI reports
Assist with data audits and quality checks
Document key processes for handover or team integration


Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role

Nice-to-Have Skills:


Basic knowledge of Python for data (pandas, Jupyter)
Experience with Google Sheets, Looker Studio, or cloud data sources


Previous contract work or experience in fast-paced environments

Required Skills & Qualifications:


1–2 years of experience in a data analyst or BI support role (internship or freelance acceptable)
Proficiency in Excel, Power BI, and/or Tableau
Solid knowledge of SQL and relational databases
Understanding of data cleaning and reporting workflows
Strong attention to detail and ability to meet deadlines
Good communication skills and a proactive, collaborative mindset


Together, as owners, let’s turn meaningful insights into action.

Life at CGI is rooted in ownership, teamwork, respect and belonging. Here, you’ll reach your full potential because…

You are invited to be an owner from day 1 as we work together to bring our Dream to life. That’s why we call ourselves CGI Partners rather than employees. We benefit from our collective success and actively shape our company’s strategy and direction.

Your work creates value. You’ll develop innovative solutions and build relationships with teammates and clients while accessing global capabilities to scale your ideas, embrace new opportunities, and benefit from expansive industry and technology expertise.

You’ll shape your career by joining a company built to grow and last. You’ll be supported by leaders who care about your health and well-being and provide you with opportunities to deepen your skills and broaden your horizons.

Come join our team—one of the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world.


Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
¿Deseas unirte a una compañía donde las personas son lo primero?




Eurofirms Group es la primera empresa nacional de Recursos Humanos. Desde hace más de 30 años, hemos consolidado un modelo de gestión por valores en el sector de Recursos Humanos, basado en tres pilares fundamentales: Personas-PeopleFirst, Innovación y Excelencia.




Somos una empresa orientada a las personas, con buen ambiente de trabajo y con responsabilidad social.




En Eurofirms Group creemos en el talento único de cada persona y sabemos que la diversidad aporta valor a los equipos, impulsando organizaciones más innovadoras, creativas y eficientes. Por eso, de acuerdo con nuestra cultura People first, trabajamos para generar entornos laborales inclusivos en los que cada individuo pueda crecer y desarrollar su mejor versión. Asimismo, buscamos actuar como agentes de cambio para promover la igualdad de oportunidades en nuestro entorno, fomentando el respeto y apostando por la diversidad en todas sus formas.

Seas como seas y sientas como sientas, en Eurofirms Group tendrás un sitio para brillar.




¿Deseas unirte a una empresa que crece y evoluciona constantemente?




Seleccionamos a Data Analyst para formar parte del área de IT de Eurofirms en nuestra oficina de Madrid.




Retribución en función de los valores aportados.




¿Qué harás?

Tu misión principal será la de habilitar la toma de decisiones de negocio informadas mediante datos e información.

Entre tus funciones, te ocuparás de las siguientes tareas:

Diseñar una solución basada en datos a las preguntas de negocio planteadas.
Trabajar con el resto del equipo de datos (Data Engineers y Data Scientists) para implementar las soluciones propuestas.
Elaborar informes y cuadros de mando mediante herramientas de Business Intelligence, destinados a las demás funciones de negocio que consuman la información.
Realizar extracciones de datos a medida que responden a necesidades puntuales de información.




¿Qué esperamos de ti?

Buscamos una persona con una buena comunicación y buena capacidad de escucha, con atención al detalle y orientado al servicio. Alguien proactivo y autónomo.




Aptitudes necesarias

Interlocución con diversos niveles organizativos y diversas áreas funcionales.
Capacidad de traducir del lenguaje de negocio al técnico y viceversa.
Pensamiento estratégico y orientado a sistemas.
Interpretar y asimilar información fragmentada.
Construir historias relevantes a partir de la información contenida en los datos.




Requisitos

Herramientas y conceptos de Business Intelligence (Microsoft, Tableau, QlikSense o similares)
Herramientas de scripting en herramientas de Business Intelligence (SSAS, DAX, Qlik scripting…)
Conocimientos de visualización de datos y visual storytelling (Power BI, Informes SSRS o similares)
Conceptos de modelado de datos e información
Bases de datos y SQL
Hojas de cálculo y tablas dinámicas (Excel)




Se valorará

Aportar experiencia en herramientas de ETL (SSIS, Power Query, Talend, Informatica Power Center, …)
Tener conocimientos adicionales de programación.
Idioma inglés.




¿Qué ventajas tiene trabajar en una empresa People first?

En Eurofirms Group te ofrecemos el mejor entorno y condiciones para que puedas brillar tanto en tu vida profesional como en la personal.




Un trabajo que hace de la conciliación una realidad

Tarde libre semanal
Tres días de teletrabajo a la semana
Retribución flexible para ahorrar en tus gastos de manutención, transporte, guardería o seguro médico a través de Cobee




Tu salud, y la de los tuyos, es lo primero

Mutua de salud gratuita y con descuentos para tu familia, a partir de los 2 años en Eurofirms
Descuentos en la cuota de múltiples gimnasios, entrenamientos personales, nutrición y salud mental disponibles en la app Wellhub.




A tu lado en los momentos especiales

Día libre el día de tu cumpleaños




Si te apasiona el mundo de la innovación y la tecnología, esta es tu oportunidad para crecer en la primera empresa nacional de recursos humanos. ¡Únete a nuestro equipo EurofirmsIT!

HTML:
¿Deseas unirte a una compañía donde las personas son lo primero?


Eurofirms Group es la primera empresa nacional de Recursos Humanos. Desde hace más de 30 años, hemos consolidado un modelo de gestión por valores en el sector de Recursos Humanos, basado en tres pilares fundamentales: Personas-PeopleFirst, Innovación y Excelencia.


Somos una empresa orientada a las personas, con buen ambiente de trabajo y con responsabilidad social.


En Eurofirms Group creemos en el talento único de cada persona y sabemos que la diversidad aporta valor a los equipos, impulsando organizaciones más innovadoras, creativas y eficientes. Por eso, de acuerdo con nuestra cultura People first, trabajamos para generar entornos laborales inclusivos en los que cada individuo pueda crecer y desarrollar su mejor versión. Asimismo, buscamos actuar como agentes de cambio para promover la igualdad de oportunidades en nuestro entorno, fomentando el respeto y apostando por la diversidad en todas sus formas.

Seas como seas y sientas como sientas, en Eurofirms Group tendrás un sitio para brillar.

Title: DATA ANALYST
Description:
¿Te apasiona el análisis de datos y la protección de la información? ¡Esta oportunidad es para ti!




Buscamos un/a Analista Técnico de Datos para incorporarse al equipo de Sistemas e Innovación de nuestro cliente. Esta persona será responsable de la explotación de la información contenida en distintos repositorios y bases de datos, así como de su protección, trabajando en estrecha colaboración con el responsable de datos del área.




🛠️ Responsabilidades principales:

Identificación y protección de datos sensibles.
Creación de consultas en diferentes bases de datos.
Elaboración de informes de uso y rendimiento.
Explotación de herramientas de Business Intelligence (BI).
Revisión de regulaciones relacionadas con la protección de datos.
Diseño de sistemas de monitorización y auditoría de datos.
Documentación de la estructura de las bases de datos.
Gestión de tareas de informática forense.




📌 Funciones adicionales:

Mantenimiento del mapa de datos de los sistemas de información del cliente.
Colaboración en la definición e implementación de directrices y procedimientos para el cumplimiento de las políticas de sistemas de información, así como su seguimiento.




📍 Ubicación y condiciones:

Lugar de trabajo: Barcelona
Tipo de contrato: Indefinido
Modelo de trabajo: Híbrido (combinando presencialidad y teletrabajo)




🎯 Perfil buscado:

Experiencia en análisis de datos y herramientas BI.
Conocimientos en protección de datos y normativa aplicable.
Capacidad para trabajar en equipo y colaborar con diferentes áreas.
Rigurosidad, proactividad y orientación a resultados.




🎓 Requisitos del perfil:

Titulación:

Grado en Ingeniería Informática y/o Telecomunicaciones (o equivalente)

Experiencia:

Participación en al menos 2 proyectos relacionados con gestión de datos en los últimos 2 años

Conocimientos valorables:

Consultas en bases de datos (SQL)
Herramientas de BI e informes
Visio y Excel avanzado
Monitorización y auditoría (Audit Vault, Oracle)
Certificaciones y experiencia en explotación de datos y ciberseguridad




Si estás buscando un nuevo reto profesional en Barcelona, con estabilidad y flexibilidad, ¡nos encantaría conocerte!




📩 ¿Te interesa? Escríbeme o deja tu comentario y te contacto.

Title: Data Analyst (Ads Team)
Description:
We’re always looking for the ones truly passionate about their work. If you are amongst them, you can rest assured there is a place for you in eMAG. We’ve grown very fast and are determined to keep doing so. What brought us here is our desire for continuous evolution and practical results.

More than 6000 colleagues are part of eMAG Teams . We strongly believe in people's development and therefore every year we invest more and more energy and resources to remain an organization that is constantly learning. We want to ensure that you’ll have the most talented colleagues and the proper environment to grow and achieve great results, to become what you desire on a personal and professional level. Join us, grow faster !

Data Analyst (Ads Team)

As an Ads Data Analyst, you’ll play a critical role in analyzing considerable amounts of structured and unstructured data generated by both sides of our advertising platform (advertisers and users) and delivering insights that drive product development, customer success, user experience, and business objectives.

eMAG Ads is a distinct business vertical spanning both sides of the Marketplace, advertisers and customers. It consists of a demand-side suite of campaign, budget, targeting management and reporting tools, and a supply-side array of applications responsible for the real-time bidding, delivery and data collection functions of a cohesive PPC advertising Platform.

What you’ll have to do:


Extract, transform and load raw data from access logs, change data capture systems, databases, datalakes and other sources.
Perform exploratory data analysis on structured and unstructured data.
Derive insights and produce monitoring dashboards, reports, funnels and visualisations.
Produce insights from data related to operational, exploratory, hypothesis driven and experimental objectives.
Work closely with product, development, data platform and data science teams in problem and solution discovery, experiment design and decision making processes.
Understand existing datasets and available data; help design and shape new data collection and processing pipelines for new and existing features.
Monitor data quality, operational and experimental metrics and KPIs.


What makes you a good fit:


Proficient in SQL (capable of executing complex SQL queries); proficient in spreadsheet software such as Excel or Google Spreadsheets.
Experienced in deriving and communicating insights from data (abstract), via reports, visualizations or other modes of presentation (concrete), for a diverse stakeholder audience.
Resourceful, problem-solver.
Having a continuous improvement mindset, in love with the problem, not the solution.
Good communication skills, both written and oral (Romanian, English).
2-3 years of proven experience in a Data Analyst or similar role.


What makes you stand out:


Good command of Python/Jupyter Notebook.
Familiarity with Python libraries for more advanced data analysis and visualizations.
Working statistical knowledge.
Experience with query engines (AWS Athena, GCP Big Query, Impala).
Experience with cloud-based data solutions (AWS, GCP).


What we’ve prepared for you:


Medical subscription: Medicover, MedLife or Regina Maria.
A flexible budget that you can invest in yourself as you wish: meal tickets, holiday tickets, cultural vouchers, private pension, foreign language classes, eMAG, Fashion Days, Therme and Genius, membership to different gyms or even professional development classes.
Different discounts from our partners: banking, mobile, dental medicine or wellness.
Access to the Bookster library and free credits on the Hilio psycho-emotional health platform.
An accelerated learning environment, with access to over 100.000 curated online resources and platforms, learning academies and development programs.
New headquarters, where sleek design, natural light, and versatile spaces create an energizing and comfortable environment for hybrid work.


#midsenior

Curious to find out more about the next step in your career? Apply now and if your experience is relevant for the role you wish, we will give you a call for more details! Also, here you can find our confidentiality policy if you want to consult it.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
¡En @Ayesa crecemos juntos! 🚀 ✨




En Ayesa no esperamos al futuro, lo lideramos. A través de la tecnología y la ingeniería lo hacemos posible, convirtiendo retos en oportunidades, conceptos en soluciones y visión en impacto real. Paso a paso nos acercamos a un futuro mejor. Con tu pasión, talento y determinación, seguiremos transformando el presente y construyendo el futuro. Ayesa, Making It Happen.




Si eres una persona con vocación por la tecnología y quieres continuar con tu desarrollo profesional, a la vez que concilias tu vida profesional y personal… ¡Este es tu sitio!

En esta ocasión buscamos ampliar nuestro equipo con un/a Analista Digital con conocimientos en GA4, BigQuery y Power BI, que quieran continuar construyendo el futuro con nosotros/as.

¡Anímate a dar el salto! ¡Te estamos esperando!







Requisitos y funciones

Capacidad Analítica alta: que sea capaz de definir KPIs, obtener insights, proponer nuevas mediciones (ya sea a través de nuevas métricas, nuevas dimensiones o nuevas tablas)
Google Analytics 4 (GA4) y Bigquery: conocimiento medio-alto
SQL: conocimiento medio-alto
Power BI: conocimiento medio-alto







Valorable (no necesario):

SnowFlake
Python nivel medio enfocado a datos (pandas, numpy, request, etc)
Gobernanza de datos con herramientas de orquestación como Airflow, Composer, Dataflow, Workflow, etc.
Optimización de BBDD, Datasets, tablas, relación entre ellas, optimizar coste, etc




Ubicación: presencialidad en las oficinas de A Coruña










Te ofrecemos un camino lleno de aventuras:




🔹 ¡Llega hasta donde tú quieras! Crece con nuestros programas de desarrollo! Te ayudaremos a marcar tu itinerario de futuro anualmente participando en proyectos vanguardistas con los mejores profesionales del sector.

🔹 Porque lo importante sois tú y los tuyos : contamos con políticas que facilitan la conciliación entre la vida profesional y personal: Flexibilidad horaria, Smart Job y jornada intensiva en verano.

🔹 Tú decides cómo usar tu dinero: disfruta de nuestra retribución flexible, contamos con: Seguro médico, Ticket Restaurant, Guardería y Transporte.

🔹 Plan Bienestar descuentos en viajes, tecnología, formación, deporte, belleza y ¡muchos más.

🔹 Diviértete participando en los diferentes concursos y actividades que organizamos: ¿te gusta el deporte, escribir, la fotografía? Todo tiene cabida.

🔹¡Actualízate! apostamos por un aprendizaje continuo, contamos con formación especializada, certificaciones e idiomas.

🔹¡Deja tu huella! Impacta con nuestros proyectos de voluntariado social.







¡Únete a la multinacional española tecnológica referente en el mundo! 💫🌎




Atendiendo a la Ley Orgánica 3/2007, de 22 de marzo, Ayesa se ha marcado como objetivo promover la defensa y aplicación efectiva del principio de igualdad entre hombres y mujeres, evitando cualquier tipo de discriminación laboral por razón de sexo, garantizando así las mismas oportunidades de ingreso. Asimismo, fomentamos la diversidad, rechazando cualquier tipo de discriminación por razones de raza, sexo, diversidad funcional, religión, orientación sexual, identidad sexual, o cualquier otra condición personal o social, apostando por construir un entorno inclusivo y enriquecedor.

Title: Data Functional Analyst (SNS02498)
Description:
Job Description


The Data Functional Data Analyst is in regular contact with the different business stakeholders (data teams and subject matter experts) to understand their business needs. He/she identify, assess and understand business processes, operational and analytics data flows (incoming and outgoing). He/she translates the business needs into data and technical requirements.
He/she designs the data architecture and the data models in collaboration with Data Architects.
He/she establishes the functional design for our developments in full collaboration with the Data Governance team, the Technical Leads of the BI team and the ICT teams.
He/she is in contact with the DPO to ensure full alignment with GDPR and security requirements.
The Data Functional Analyst plays an active role in testing and validating the data products developed.
The major deliverables the analyst is responsible for are : the Business Requirements Document, the Functional Analysis Document, the Technical Analysis, and the Test Plan.
After delivery of the product, he/she remains the key player to inform and train our users.
Even after delivery, he/she remains the liaison with the end users in order to further improve our data products.


Your Technical Skills


Master degree in Computer Science or equivalent through experience
Minimum 5-7 years of practical and professional experience in data functional analysis.
Concrete experience in data modelling (mainly conceptual and logical modelling) within a data warehouse context (preferably following the Kimball approach).
Concrete experience in designing and analysing data flows.
Prior experience as a data engineer is a plus.


Skills

Data architecture

Data functional analysis

Data modeling

Data Quality Monitoring

Negotiate technical proposals

SQL

Hiring Team Member

Oplus_131072

Mahalakshmi Pechetti

HR Associate


LinkedIn
Mail
Show more
HTML:
Job Description

  • The Data Functional Data Analyst is in regular contact with the different business stakeholders (data teams and subject matter experts) to understand their business needs. He/she identify, assess and understand business processes, operational and analytics data flows (incoming and outgoing). He/she translates the business needs into data and technical requirements.
  • He/she designs the data architecture and the data models in collaboration with Data Architects.
  • He/she establishes the functional design for our developments in full collaboration with the Data Governance team, the Technical Leads of the BI team and the ICT teams.
  • He/she is in contact with the DPO to ensure full alignment with GDPR and security requirements.
  • The Data Functional Analyst plays an active role in testing and validating the data products developed.
  • The major deliverables the analyst is responsible for are : the Business Requirements Document, the Functional Analysis Document, the Technical Analysis, and the Test Plan.
  • After delivery of the product, he/she remains the key player to inform and train our users.
  • Even after delivery, he/she remains the liaison with the end users in order to further improve our data products.

Your Technical Skills

  • Master degree in Computer Science or equivalent through experience
  • Minimum 5-7 years of practical and professional experience in data functional analysis.
  • Concrete experience in data modelling (mainly conceptual and logical modelling) within a data warehouse context (preferably following the Kimball approach).
  • Concrete experience in designing and analysing data flows.
  • Prior experience as a data engineer is a plus.

Skills

Data architecture

Data functional analysis

Data modeling

Data Quality Monitoring

Negotiate technical proposals

SQL

Title: TEAM LEADER/JEFE/A DE EQUIPO INDEFINIDO
Description:
¿Estás preparado para un nuevo reto profesional?

En Logisfashion estamos buscando un Team Leader/Jefe/a de equipo con interés en desarrollarse en el área de operaciones de la compañía y con ganas de asumir nuevos retos profesionales.

LOGISFASHION marca la diferencia. Gracias a sus valores, el GRUPO LOGISFASHION se ha convertido en el operador logístico textil líder a nivel a mundial, somos tu partner logístico internacional de retail y ecommerce.

Aprovecha el nuevo reto que te ofrece LOGISFASHION en el área de operaciones y no pierdas la oportunidad de trabajar con nosotros. Puedes marcar la diferencia.

Unidad de negocio

Serás uno de los Team Leader/Jefe/a de equipo del centro de trabajo ubicado en Ontígola, reportando al Area Manager del GRUPO LOGISFASHION.

Funciones

Como Team Leader/Jefe/a de equipo darás apoyo operativo, documental y de recopilación de datos al Area Manager, debiendo transmitir las instrucciones dadas por éste a los manipuladores con el objetivo de lograr la realización de las tareas demandadas por el cliente.


Control de stock.
Resolución de todo tipo de problemas e incidencias con el cliente y su operativa.
Creación de oleadas (entradas, pedidos...)
Contacto directo con el cliente.
Seguimiento de la actividad asignada.
Comprobación en los programas informáticos del estado de la operación.
Gestión de expediciones.
Detección de necesidades de compra de material.
Soporte en la organización y planificación de tareas y turnos del equipo.
Seguimiento y comprobación de que las tareas de manipulación se están realizando


correctamente.

¿Qué ofrecemos?


Contrato indefinido
Horario rotativo de mañana y tarde de lunes a domingo
Posibilidad real de crecimiento en multinacional consolidada


Requisitos:

Nivel Excel medio/alto.

Valorable conocimientos en logística. Es necesario aportar una experiencia previa de 1 año en posiciones similares, preferiblemente en el sector industrial o logístico.

Title: Madrid Office - Associate (m/f/d) (Entry level position) - Start March 2026
Description:
Location

Madrid

Job Description

About L.E.K. Consulting

L.E.K. Consulting is a global strategy consulting firm that addresses the most critical commercial issues for the leaders of some of the world's most successful businesses.

Clients come to us time and again because we are proven to act as an insightful expert and a trusted partner. We are uncompromising in our approach to help clients make better decisions at crucial moments, changing the trajectory of their enterprise, delivering improved business performance and creating greater shareholder returns.

Our teams combine our core capabilities of research, benchmarking, modelling, data & analytics and strategy development to create game-changing insights and practical solutions that seize competitive advantage and unlock new growth opportunities. We enable clients to make critical decisions with greater certainty and empower them to master their moments of truth.

With more than 2,300 professionals located across five continents, L.E.K. specialises in Strategy and Mergers & Acquisitions (M&A) support with clients across the full range of corporates and private equity. We are expert in a wide range of industries, including Life Sciences and healthcare, retail and consumer, financial services, industrials, energy and transportation.

The Associate position

The Associate role at L.E.K. offers exposure to multiple industry sectors and a wide variety of commercial challenges. The nature and pace of L.E.K.’s strategic work facilitates the rapid development of a highly analytical skill set in a collaborative and rewarding team-based environment. As you progress you will take on a significant level of responsibility and build your leadership skills.

Responsibilities

Associates are crucial to the success of L.E.K. project teams. With the guidance and support of an experienced senior team, you will be responsible for:


Conducting primary and secondary research on markets, competitors, and customers
Performing rigorous strategic and financial analyses, using leading-edge software and techniques, to develop deep understanding of commercial issues
Collaborating with team members to identify trends, draw conclusions, develop insights and transform those insights into actionable recommendations for the client
Making L.E.K. an enjoyable and rewarding place to work by coaching colleagues and transferring skills, offering constructive advice, and contributing to a welcoming and friendly office culture


Who We Are Looking For

We are currently seeking exceptional and committed individuals with the ability to solve complex problems in a creative way. Successful candidates typically possess outstanding academic achievements, are comfortable with quantitative analysis, have excellent verbal and written communication skills in Spanish and English, relevant professional experience, and notable extracurricular interests. Fluency in another European language is considered an asset.

We are looking for a sense of intellectual curiosity that will inspire you to develop a deep understanding of any client situation, and to generate innovative answers to complex questions. We want people with the ability to think in logical, structured ways, together with the creativity to look beyond the obvious. We recruit from a wide range of disciplines in both the arts and sciences, and do not require existing technical skills – just a strong desire to learn.

Our team-oriented approach requires individuals who can collaborate and communicate well. We seek proactive, energetic, and enthusiastic candidates who take ownership of their work and make a meaningful impact.

What We Offer

Training and development

The Associate position at L.E.K. is a launch-pad for your career. As a new Associate you will be supported with a comprehensive initial two-week orientation programme, followed by thorough monthly training sessions designed to complement your on-the-job experience. These cover the full range of skills needed to develop and progress your career within L.E.K., allowing promotion to the Consultant role without attaining an MBA. For those who go on to pursue roles in industry or Private Equity, the highly valuable commercial and analytical skill set, and broad commercial experience of an L.E.K. Associate are in great demand.

International Experience And Exchange Programme

L.E.K. offers you the opportunity to swap to one of our global offices for six months. This is a popular way to experience a different business environment, gain exposure to new industries and specialisms and experience a different culture. In addition, you will often work with colleagues from other offices, on projects with an international scope.

Application Process

Our application process is now open for positions starting in March 2026.

Please upload your application documents (cover letter, CV, references) on our career site by clicking the "Apply" button.

After completing the online application process, selected candidates will be contacted by our Recruitment Team and invited to a numerical reasoning test followed by a series of interviews. Applicants stating 'fluency' in a language will have this assessed during the recruitment process. Please note that fluency in both Spanish and English are a requirement for this position.

We are looking forward to receiving your application!

Diversity and inclusion at L.E.K.

Here at L.E.K., we appreciate the value of a diverse and inclusive workforce and are committed to a culture that is inclusive and accepting of all people. Above all, we are committed to ensuring that all employees are treated with respect and dignity. L.E.K. Consulting is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

We have several affinity groups to support and enrich our employees and in addition, our Diversity and Inclusion committee celebrate events throughout the year with a focus on awareness and education.

Title: Technical Power BI consultant (SNS02497)
Description:
Job Description

The main responsibility of the Technical BI consultant is to ensure the implementation of integrated reports, dashboards and any alerts based on MS PowerBI for the following reports:


Internal financial reporting based on SAP ECC6 data and other sources Reporting in relation to customer service based on SAP ISU data and other sources HR-type reporting (such as dashboards and absenteeism reports, work accident reports, using different databases (old technology such as AG software, Windev, …) Annual reporting at the CSRD & Taxonomy level Reporting to our regulator Brugel And this is especially from a technical point of view (ETL, data lake, date warehouse, data consumption and data publication)
In addition, he will also be in charge of monitoring the run and the operational maintenance of the PowerBI environment.
Throughout your assignment, you comply with GDPR, ISO27001 and NIS2 rules.
The appointed consultant will be assigned full-time to the execution of the contract and will have to work potentially 440 man-days spread over a period of ± 2 years, on an hourly basis of 24 hours per week, during the opening days of Client. The services will be performed at least 3 days/week in person at Client’s head office, potentially on a discontinuous basis, unless expressly exempted by the Head of the IT Department. The Consultant is informed that he is not authorised to work overtime or outside office hours (Monday to Friday from 7:00 am to 7:00 pm) without the express authorisation of Client. The appointed consultant must take into account the needs of continuity of service of Client and the constraints related to the projects it manages in the planning of its leave and will agree in advance with the Senior Official on this subject The appointed consultant must comply with the provisions of Client’s “”Code of Conduct for External Providers””


Skills


ETL
M365 architecture
Microsoft Azure
Microsoft Azure data factory
Microsoft Azure data lake
Microsoft Azure data warehouse
Microsoft Fabric/PowerBI
Multidimensional modelling
SAP ECC
SAP ECC table connector
SAP S4Hana
SAP S4Hana ISU
SQL inclusing partitioning


Hiring Team Member

Sriram Sripati

Talent Acquisition Specialist

Title: Addetto/a Gestione Clienti – Beni per la Casa e la Persona
Description:
Azienda commerciale operante nella distribuzione di beni per la cura della persona e della casa ricerca una risorsa da inserire nel team vendite, con attività di presidio in aree territoriali assegnate e supporto diretto alla clientela.

Mansioni principali:


Presidio del territorio per presentare i prodotti aziendali e raccogliere richieste dei clienti
Supporto informativo e consulenza di base per orientare il cliente nelle scelte
Raccolta di dati e aggiornamento delle informazioni tramite strumenti digitali aziendali
Collaborazione con il team interno per la pianificazione delle attività commerciali
Contributo al raggiungimento degli obiettivi di crescita e mantenimento degli standard di servizio


Requisiti richiesti:


Attitudine al contatto con il pubblico e buone capacità comunicative
Predisposizione al lavoro di squadra e capacità organizzative
Precisione, affidabilità e attenzione ai dettagli
Disponibilità a spostamenti nell’area territoriale assegnata
Gradita esperienza in ruoli a contatto con i clienti, ma valutiamo anche profili junior motivati


Offerta:


Contratto a tempo determinato di 3 mesi, rinnovabile
Orario full time, dal lunedì al venerdì
Formazione retribuita e affiancamento operativo


Sede di lavoro: Cassino

Title: IT Specialist
Description:
SYNLAB è una multinazionale, presente in Europa, Asia, Africa e Sud America, composta da quasi 30 mila dipendenti, che collaborano con il principale obiettivo di migliorare il benessere dei pazienti.

In Italia, con un team di oltre 4 mila professionisti, SYNLAB rappresenta il più importante e vasto gruppo di diagnostica integrata nei Medical Center e il più importante interlocutore dei servizi di Laboratorio. Lombardia, Veneto, Friuli-Venezia Giulia, Toscana, Emilia-Romagna, Liguria, Lazio e Campania sono le regioni in cui si sviluppa principalmente l'attività di SYNLAB che è comunque presente in tutta Italia con partner accreditati.

🧪La Mission: fornire informazioni diagnostiche utili per una vita sana e per il benessere di tutti.

🩸La Vision: una leadership conquistata attraverso l’eccellenza del servizio a favore delle persone e della comunità medica, con una diagnostica di altissima qualità.

🩺I Valori: passione, responsabilità e customer centricity.

Scopri di più: https://www.synlab.it

Posizione:

La risorsa si occuperà prevalentemente di supportare il team IT nelle seguenti attività:


gestione e manutenzione dell’infrastruttura informatica delle diverse sedi del gruppo (principalmente in provincia di Padova)
attività di help desk di primo e secondo livello su sistemi hardware e software aziendali
gestione degli asset, manutenzione hardware, aggiornamenti tecnologici programmati e straordinari
attività sistemistiche su Active Directory e servizi di rete
supporto alle funzioni aziendali
coinvolgimento in progetti e attività IT


Requisiti:

La risorsa ideale possiede i seguenti requisiti:


Ottima conoscenza dell’hardware PC, Stampanti e periferiche
Esperienza in help desk primo e/o secondo livello
Buone competenze di networking
Ottima conoscenza di Microsoft Office
Ottima conoscenza dei sistemi Microsoft Active Directory e sistemi operativi Microsoft in generale.
Conoscenza dei sistemi di virtualizzazione VMWare
Gradita conoscenza applicativi sanitari (order entry, RIS, PACS, LIS…).
Patente B


Completano il profilo:


Elevata proattività, autonomia e orientamento all’obiettivo.
Flessibilità, capacità di lavorare con scadenze ravvicinate e in modo multifocalizzato
Determinazione, spirito di iniziativa e forte automotivazione alla crescita personale


Altre informazioni:

Sede di Lavoro: Albignasego (PD)

Orario: Full time 40 ore. A settimane alterne dal lunedì a venerdì una settimana e l’altra settimana dal lunedì al sabato

Contratto: Tempo determinato 6 mesi con possibilità di successiva di proroga (non si esclude la trasformazione a T.I )

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
wherewework.bg on behalf of:

talaint by Human Recruiters®

Our client is a dynamic and fast-growing UK-based IT consultancy, specialising in delivering cutting-edge technology solutions and driving digital transformation for leading European companies across industries such as Banking, Retail, Insurance, Healthcare, Energy, and Consumer Goods. Their expertise spans SAP and Salesforce implementation and customisation, legacy-to-cloud migration, and platform re-engineering, enabling businesses to optimise their operations and stay ahead in an evolving digital landscape.

As part of their newly established operations in Bulgaria, they are currently seeking a Data Engineer to join a client’s distributed technical team supporting a gaming analytics solution. The role is fully remote in Bulgaria, and candidates can be either employed as contractors or on permanent labour agreements with a local Bulgarian entity. The company offers 23 days of paid annual leave. It is not a project-based work, but a long-term engagement.

Data Engineer

Responsibilities


Design, build, and maintain ETL/ELT pipelines and batch/streaming workflows.
Build connectors to external partners and integrate data from APIs and internal systems.
Develop custom functions to process and transform data for analytics and reporting.
Integrate and manage data within Snowflake and other downstream tools.
Own and optimize orchestration workflows using Airflow and Kafka-based event streams.
Ensure data quality, reliability, and observability across platforms and pipelines.
Collaborate across teams to improve existing solutions and support data-driven decisions.


Requirements


University degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, or Business Informatics.
3+ years of experience as a Data Engineer or Software Engineer working on data infrastructure.
Strong programming skills in Python, with hands-on experience in SQL and Snowflake.
Experience with orchestration tools (e.g., Airflow) and data streaming platforms (e.g., Kafka).
Solid understanding of data modeling, governance, and performance tuning in data warehouse environments.
Ability to work independently and manage priorities across multiple stakeholders and systems.
Comfortable working in a cloud-native environment (e.g., AWS), with tools like Terraform and Docker.


This position is for a company that fosters innovation and values collaboration. This resonates deeply with talaint’s core mission, and we believe it could be a compelling step forward for your career. In case you are interested in the position, please send your CV in English and we would be happy to discuss it further.

Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted by our consultants.

Applying for this position, you are authorizing talaint to work and process your personal information following the Law for Personal Data Protection.

Agency license Number 2123 was issued on 04.10.2016.
Show more
HTML:
wherewework.bg on behalf of:

talaint by Human Recruiters®

Our client is a dynamic and fast-growing UK-based IT consultancy, specialising in delivering cutting-edge technology solutions and driving digital transformation for leading European companies across industries such as Banking, Retail, Insurance, Healthcare, Energy, and Consumer Goods. Their expertise spans SAP and Salesforce implementation and customisation, legacy-to-cloud migration, and platform re-engineering, enabling businesses to optimise their operations and stay ahead in an evolving digital landscape.

As part of their newly established operations in Bulgaria, they are currently seeking a Data Engineer to join a client’s distributed technical team supporting a gaming analytics solution. The role is fully remote in Bulgaria, and candidates can be either employed as contractors or on permanent labour agreements with a local Bulgarian entity. The company offers 23 days of paid annual leave. It is not a project-based work, but a long-term engagement.

Data Engineer

Responsibilities

  • Design, build, and maintain ETL/ELT pipelines and batch/streaming workflows.
  • Build connectors to external partners and integrate data from APIs and internal systems.
  • Develop custom functions to process and transform data for analytics and reporting.
  • Integrate and manage data within Snowflake and other downstream tools.
  • Own and optimize orchestration workflows using Airflow and Kafka-based event streams.
  • Ensure data quality, reliability, and observability across platforms and pipelines.
  • Collaborate across teams to improve existing solutions and support data-driven decisions.

Requirements

  • University degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, or Business Informatics.
  • 3+ years of experience as a Data Engineer or Software Engineer working on data infrastructure.
  • Strong programming skills in Python, with hands-on experience in SQL and Snowflake.
  • Experience with orchestration tools (e.g., Airflow) and data streaming platforms (e.g., Kafka).
  • Solid understanding of data modeling, governance, and performance tuning in data warehouse environments.
  • Ability to work independently and manage priorities across multiple stakeholders and systems.
  • Comfortable working in a cloud-native environment (e.g., AWS), with tools like Terraform and Docker.

This position is for a company that fosters innovation and values collaboration. This resonates deeply with talaint’s core mission, and we believe it could be a compelling step forward for your career. In case you are interested in the position, please send your CV in English and we would be happy to discuss it further.

Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted by our consultants.

Applying for this position, you are authorizing talaint to work and process your personal information following the Law for Personal Data Protection.

Title: Addetto/a Attività Informativa – Distribuzione Materiale Informativo
Description:
Società attiva nel settore della comunicazione e dei servizi informativi seleziona un/una Addetto/a Attività Informativa da inserire per attività di contatto diretto con il pubblico in aree assegnate.

Attività previste


Distribuzione di materiale informativo presso aree predefinite
Consegna di documentazione e coupon promozionali
Supporto alle richieste informative da parte del pubblico
Raccolta di dati non sensibili per finalità organizzative interne


Requisiti richiesti


Diploma di scuola secondaria di secondo grado
Capacità comunicative e relazionali
Precisione nello svolgimento delle attività assegnate
Attitudine al lavoro in team e disponibilità agli spostamenti


Offerta e benefit


Contratto a tempo determinato, con orario full-time
Buoni pasto giornalieri
Inserimento con formazione operativa retribuita
Attività pianificata in base alla zona di residenza


Sede di lavoro: Acireale

Title: Técnico(a) Administrativo(a) Recursos Humanos
HTML:
PERFIL

  • Licenciatura em Recursos Humanos ou Psicologia Social das Organizações (preferencial);
  • Capacidade de comunicação (escrita e verbal), argumentação e relacionamento interpessoal;
  • Aptidão analítica, atenção ao detalhe e rigor;
  • Interesse e empatia pela gestão de pessoas, com capacidade para lidar com assuntos confidenciais;
  • Conhecimento da legislação laboral e normas em vigor para o setor (preferencial);
  • Nível intermédio de inglês, falado e escrito (preferencial);
  • Experiência com o ERP Microsoft Dynamics 365 será valorizada.

FUNÇÕES

  • Gestão de processos individuais, assiduidades e processamento salarial;
  • Monitorização e comunicação de sinistros de colaboradores e coordenação da medicina do trabalho;
  • Gestão contratual: elaboração, renovação e cessação de contratos; comunicação com entidades competentes; atualização e acompanhamento da situação laboral.
  • Assegurar o cumprimento da legislação laboral e normas legais em vigor para o setor, comunicar com entidades externas e esclarecer dúvidas neste âmbito;
  • Entrega das obrigações contributivas e fiscais e respetivo reporte à área financeira;
  • Garantir os registos necessários para a elaboração e entrega de relatórios obrigatórios.

OFERECEMOS

  • Integração numa empresa de referência no mercado;
  • Formação inicial e contínua;
  • Entrada imediata;
  • Remuneração adequada para a função e experiência;
  • Benefícios ativos na empresa.

Title: Lead Data Engineer (m/w/d)
Description:
Unternehmensbeschreibung


Wir fördern Dein persönliches Wachstum, gemeinsamen Erfolg und neue Innovationen.

Mit über 25 Jahren Erfahrung, mehr als 10.000 Tech- und Business-Experten weltweit und rund 5.000 Zertifizierungen sind wir ein führendes, technologieungebundenes Beratungs- und Dienstleistungsunternehmen. Unser Schwerpunkt liegt auf der Realisierung digitaler Strategien durch den Einsatz von Plattformtechnologien, Cybersicherheit und umfassenden Unternehmenstransformationen. Als strategischer Partner führender SaaS- und Cloud-Anbieter wie AWS, Google Cloud, Microsoft, ServiceNow, Salesforce und SAP kombinieren wir innovative Softwarelösungen mit erstklassigen Professional Services, um für unsere Kunden echten Mehrwert zu schaffen.

Gemeinsam mit Dir gestalten wir die digitale Zukunft und entwickeln visionäre, integrierte Lösungen für unsere Kunden.

#AI DRIVEN TECH CONSULTING

Deine Benefits

Moderne Büros in Toplage in München, Frankfurt und Stuttgart
Flexibles Remote- oder Hybrid Working mit der Möglichkeit, Deine Arbeitszeiten und Arbeitsorte individuell auf Deine Bedürfnisse anzupassen
Unsere Devoteam Academy bietet Dir ein großes Angebot an zertifizierten Trainings und Sprachkursen
Internationale Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten für Deinen Karriereboost bei Devoteam
Gaming-Lounge für Deine kreative Pause zwischen Meetings und Calls
Get-Together Partys und Teamevents für den regelmäßigen Austausch und Spaß mit Deinen Kollleg:innen
Mitarbeiter:innen-Prämien beim Werben von neuen Mitarbeiter:innen
Moderne IT-Ausstattung - Wähle aus einer Vielzahl von Möglichkeiten das für Dich passende Produkt
Corporate Benefits mit großer Auswahl an zahlreichen Angeboten für nahezu jeden Bereich
Jobrad und Firmenwagen Angebot mit attraktiven steuerlichen Vorteilen für Dich
Betriebliche Altersvorsorge, Direktversicherungen und vermögenswirksame Leistungen stehen Dir als Zusatzleistungen zur Verfügung
Integration Day inkl. Mentorenprogramme für Deinen perfekten Start bei Devoteam


Stellenbeschreibung


 

Deine Aufgaben

Design und Entwicklung: Du konzipierst, entwickelst und betreibst skalierbare Datenpipelines auf modernen Cloud-Datenplattformen wie Snowflake, Databricks, Google Cloud (BigQuery) oder Azure.
Datenkonsolidierung: Du konsolidierst strukturierte und unstrukturierte Daten in zentrale Data Lakes und Warehouses, um sie für BI- und KI-Anwendungen nutzbar zu machen.
Datenmodellierung: Du implementierst robuste Datenmodelle und Speicherarchitekturen (z. B. Stern-Schema, Snowflake-Schema, Medallion-Architektur).
Data Governance & Qualität: Du stellst die Datenintegrität, -qualität, -sicherheit und Governance über den gesamten Datenlebenszyklus sicher (Data Lineage).
Automatisierung (CI/CD): Du automatisierst Workflows und Deployments mit gängigen CI/CD-Tools (z. B. GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, Jenkins).
Anforderungsanalyse: In enger Zusammenarbeit mit den Fachbereichen übersetzt Du deren Anforderungen in tragfähige technische Lösungen.
Optimierung: Du optimierst die Performance und Kosteneffizienz der Dateninfrastruktur kontinuierlich.
Strategischer Aufbau: Perspektivisch wirkst Du maßgeblich beim Aufbau und der strategischen Weiterentwicklung unseres zentralen Data & AI Bereichs mit und gestaltest dessen technologische Ausrichtung.



Beispiele Deiner zukünftigen Projekte

Modernisierung von Legacy-ETL-Workflows mithilfe von cloud-nativen Diensten und Frameworks wie dbt.
Aufbau von semantischen Datenmodellen für unternehmensweites Business Intelligence (Stern-/Snowflake-Schema).
Konzeption von Ingestion-Strecken nach der Medallion-Architektur für Batch- oder Echtzeitanalysen.
Bereitstellung von kuratierten und qualitativ hochwertigen Datenprodukten für BI- und KI-Anwendungsfälle.


Qualifikationen


Das bringst Du mit:

Erfahrung: Mindestens 3 Jahre relevante Projekterfahrung als Data Engineer. Du kommst idealerweise aus einem Konzernumfeld oder einem Produktunternehmen und bringst eine "Inhouse"-Perspektive auf den Aufbau und Betrieb von Datenplattformen mit.
Sprachen: Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift.
SQL-Expertise: Exzellente Kenntnisse in SQL, inklusive Performance-Tuning.
Datenmodellierung: Fundierte Erfahrung in der dimensionalen Datenmodellierung und mit modernen ETL/ELT-Mustern (z. B. Medallion-Architektur).
Tech-Stack: Praktische Erfahrung mit gängigen Tools und Services für Datenintegration und -verarbeitung, wie z.B. dbt, Spark, Airflow und Cloud-Services wie AWS Glue, Google Dataflow oder Azure Data Factory.



Pluspunkte sammelst Du mit:

Erfahrung mit gängigen BI-Tools wie Tableau, Power BI oder Looker.
Kenntnisse im Bereich Data Mesh oder anderer dezentraler Datenarchitekturen.
Erfahrung mit Technologien wie Delta Lake, Apache Iceberg, Unity Catalog oder Feature Stores.



Deine Persönlichkeit

Kommunikationsstärke: Ausgeprägte Kommunikations- und Dokumentationsfähigkeiten in Deutsch und Englisch.
Arbeitsweise: Eine agile und ergebnisorientierte Denkweise.
Teamplayer: Du arbeitest ebenso gerne kollaborativ im Team wie auch eigenverantwortlich.
Analytisches Denken: Deine analytische Denkweise ist stets auf die Wertschöpfung für das Unternehmen ausgerichtet.
Übersetzer: Du besitzt die Fähigkeit, geschäftliche Anforderungen in technische Lösungen zu übersetzen.
Agilität: Du hast bereits Erfahrung in agilen, funktionsübergreifenden Teams gesammelt.


Zusätzliche Informationen


You will be part of a collaborative, remote-friendly team that values continuous learning and

delivering impact through modern cloud-native data solutions.

Show more

Title: Munich Office - Associate (m/f/d) (Entry level position) - Start March 2026
Description:
Location

Munich

Job Description

About L.E.K. Consulting

L.E.K. Consulting is a global strategy consulting firm that addresses the most critical commercial issues for the leaders of some of the world's most successful businesses.

Clients come to us time and again because we are proven to act as an insightful expert and a trusted partner. We are uncompromising in our approach to help clients make better decisions at crucial moments, changing the trajectory of their enterprise, delivering improved business performance and creating greater shareholder returns.

Our teams combine our core capabilities of research, benchmarking, modelling, data & analytics and strategy development to create game-changing insights and practical solutions that seize competitive advantage and unlock new growth opportunities. We enable clients to make critical decisions with greater certainty and empower them to master their moments of truth.

With more than 2,300 professionals located across five continents, L.E.K. specialises in Strategy and Mergers & Acquisitions (M&A) support with clients across the full range of corporates and private equity. We are expert in a wide range of industries, including Life Sciences and healthcare, retail and consumer, financial services, industrials, energy and transportation.

The Associate position

The Associate role at L.E.K. offers exposure to multiple industry sectors and a wide variety of commercial challenges. The nature and pace of L.E.K.’s strategic work facilitates the rapid development of a highly analytical skill set in a collaborative and rewarding team-based environment. As you progress you will take on a significant level of responsibility and build your leadership skills.

Responsibilities

Associates are crucial to the success of L.E.K. project teams. With the guidance and support of an experienced senior team, you will be responsible for:


Conducting primary and secondary research on markets, competitors, and customers
Performing rigorous strategic and financial analyses, using leading-edge software and techniques, to develop deep understanding of commercial issues
Collaborating with team members to identify trends, draw conclusions, develop insights and transform those insights into actionable recommendations for the client
Making L.E.K. an enjoyable and rewarding place to work by coaching colleagues and transferring skills, offering constructive advice, and contributing to a welcoming and friendly office culture


Who We Are Looking For

We are currently seeking exceptional and committed individuals with the ability to solve complex problems in a creative way. Successful candidates typically possess outstanding academic achievements, are comfortable with quantitative analysis, have excellent verbal and written communication skills in German and English, relevant professional experience, and notable extracurricular interests. Fluency in another European language is considered an asset.

We are looking for a sense of intellectual curiosity that will inspire you to develop a deep understanding of any client situation, and to generate innovative answers to complex questions. We want people with the ability to think in logical, structured ways, together with the creativity to look beyond the obvious. We recruit from a wide range of disciplines in both the arts and sciences, and do not require existing technical skills – just a strong desire to learn.

Our team-oriented approach requires individuals who can collaborate and communicate well. We seek proactive, energetic, and enthusiastic candidates who take ownership of their work and make a meaningful impact.

What We Offer

Training and development

The Associate position at L.E.K. is a launch-pad for your career. As a new Associate you will be supported with a comprehensive initial two-week orientation programme, followed by thorough monthly training sessions designed to complement your on-the-job experience. These cover the full range of skills needed to develop and progress your career within L.E.K., allowing promotion to the Consultant role without attaining an MBA. For those who go on to pursue roles in industry or Private Equity, the highly valuable commercial and analytical skill set, and broad commercial experience of an L.E.K. Associate are in great demand.

International Experience And Exchange Programme

L.E.K. offers you the opportunity to swap to one of our global offices for six months. This is a popular way to experience a different business environment, gain exposure to new industries and specialisms and experience a different culture. In addition, you will often work with colleagues from other offices, on projects with an international scope.

Application Process

Our application process is now open for positions starting in March 2026.

Please upload your application documents (cover letter, CV, references) on our career site by clicking the "Apply" button.

After completing the online application process, selected candidates will be contacted by our Recruitment Team and invited to a numerical reasoning test followed by a series of interviews. Applicants stating 'fluency' in a language will have this assessed during the recruitment process. Please note that fluency in both German and English are a requirement for this position.

We are looking forward to receiving your application!

Diversity and inclusion at L.E.K.

Here at L.E.K., we appreciate the value of a diverse and inclusive workforce and are committed to a culture that is inclusive and accepting of all people. Above all, we are committed to ensuring that all employees are treated with respect and dignity. L.E.K. Consulting is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

We have several affinity groups to support and enrich our employees and in addition, our Diversity and Inclusion committee celebrate events throughout the year with a focus on awareness and education.

Here at L.E.K., we appreciate the value of a diverse and inclusive workforce and are committed to a culture that is inclusive and accepting of all people. Above all, we are committed to ensuring that all employees are treated with respect and dignity. L.E.K. Consulting is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

We have several affinity groups to support and enrich our employees and in addition, our Diversity and Inclusion committee celebrate events throughout the year with a focus on awareness and education.

Title: STAGIAIRE OU ALTERNANT EN INTELLIGENCE ARTIFICIELLE – DERNIÈRE ANNÉE D’ÉTUDES H/F – PARIS
Description:
Offres d'emploi
Stagiaire ou Alternant en Intelligence Artificielle – Dernière année d’études H/F


Détails de L’OFFRE

Nous recrutons un(e) Stagiaire ou Alternant(e) en Intelligence Artificielle – Dernière année d’études

Vous êtes en dernière année d’études avec une spécialisation en Intelligence Artificielle et vous recherchez un stage de 6 mois ou une alternance pour travailler sur des projets à fort impact ?

Nous avons l’opportunité idéale pour vous !

Vos MISSIONS


Développement Python : Vous participerez à l’automatisation des tâches à travers les outils Microsoft 365 et notre CRM, en développant des solutions intelligentes et efficaces pour améliorer la productivité des utilisateurs.
Chatbots et IA conversationnelle : Vous développerez des chatbots capables d’interactions naturelles et personnalisées, en vous assurant que l’expérience utilisateur soit fluide et intuitive.
Création de workflows automatisés : Vous contribuerez à la mise en place de workflows intelligents et optimisés pour fluidifier les processus internes de l’entreprise.
Utilisation de Azure AI Studio : Vous aurez l’occasion de développer et d’entraîner des modèles IA via Azure AI Studio, en explorant les possibilités offertes par les services d’intelligence artificielle cloud.
Développement d’outils internes : Vous participerez à la conception et au développement d’outils IA sur-mesure pour améliorer les opérations quotidiennes, en vous appuyant sur les technologies Microsoft et Azure.


Votre PROFIL


Étudiant(e) en dernière année d’un cursus spécialisé en Intelligence Artificielle, data science ou un domaine connexe.
Une bonne maîtrise de python et Azure AI Studio est un atout, ou du moins une forte motivation à monter en compétences sur ces outils.
Vous êtes passionné(e) par l’intelligence artificielle et avez une curiosité naturelle pour les technologies émergentes et l’automatisation des processus.
Vous aimez travailler en équipe, partager vos idées, et êtes capable de mener à bien des projets avec autonomie.


Ce que nous OFFRONS


Des projets concrets et à fort impact : Vous travaillerez sur des solutions utilisées au quotidien par les équipes.
Un environnement stimulant : Vous évoluerez au sein d’une équipe dynamique et bienveillante, avec la possibilité d’apprendre et de développer de nouvelles compétences.


Un cadre d’apprentissage : Nous vous accompagnerons tout au long de votre mission pour faire de cette expérience un véritable tremplin vers votre future carrière.

Si vous êtes prêt(e) à relever le défi et à contribuer au développement de solutions IA innovantes, envoyez-nous votre candidature.

Lieu de l’Alternance : Neuilly-sur-Seine (92)

Début : Dès que possible

Type de contrat : Stage (6 mois) ou Alternance Longue

Notre ENGAGEMENT DIVERSITÉ

Quanteam est handi-accueillante et s’engage en faveur de l’égalité professionnelle, de la mixité et de la diversité. Elle est ouverte à tous les talents et encourage, à ce titre, toute personne possédant les compétences mentionnées dans la présente offre, à soumettre sa candidature.

Quanteam propose un modèle d’entreprise axé sur la responsabilité, l’engagement, la gestion responsable et s’engage pour le développement durable et le respect de l’environnement.

À propos de Quanteam

Quanteam (entité du Groupe Rainbow Partners) est un cabinet de conseil spécialisé dans les secteurs Banque, Finance et Services financiers.

Nos 850 consultants, issus de 35 nationalités différentes, sont situés à Paris, Lyon, Londres, New-York, Montréal, Genève, Lisbonne, Porto, Bruxelles, Casablanca, Madrid et Singapour.

Fort d’une double compétence métier et IT, Quanteam accompagne ses clients grands comptes (banques de financement et d’investissement, sociétés de gestion d’actif, banques privées et de détail, dépositaires de titres…) sur l’ensemble de la chaine Front-to-Back, dans l’évolution de leurs activités métiers et dans leurs projets de Transformation.

Nos équipes sont organisées autour de 5 pôles d’expertises :


Finance quantitative
Risques, Conformité et Réglementaire
Opérations et Finance
Transformation et Organisation
IT et Système d’information


La vie chez Quanteam

Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?

Votre accélérateur de carrière

Ils vous en parlent

La satisfaction d’être reconnu pour son travail et d’évoluer dans une bonne ambiance

Geoffroy, Consultant Expert – Practice Finance Quantitative

Après des études en Ingénierie et un Master de Recherche en Nanotechnologie, j’ai travaillé dans les secteurs de l’Energie et du Retail, au sein de cabinets de conseil / ESN du Big Four. Puis j’ai rejoint Quanteam, en 2018, en tant que Développeur Full Stack sur des problématiques de produits structurés et produits exotiques au sein d’une grande banque française. J’avais déjà le souhait de m’orienter vers le secteur de la Banque / Finance, sur lequel j’avais commencé à me former, et j’ai été rassuré de voir que, à travers son process de recrutement sélectif, Quanteam était un acteur incontournable du marché. Dès le début, j’ai senti le soutien du cabinet dans l’accompagnement de ses consultants, via la formation. Grâce à Quanteam, j’ai d’ailleurs pu renforcer mes compétences à travers un Master en Finance Quantitative, en cours du soir, qui m’a permis d’intégrer la Practice Quant et de conjuguer mes compétences techniques à ma compréhension des problématiques Métiers, Business et Fonctionnelles.

Je souhaitais rejoindre un acteur du conseil en Banque / Finance

Salim, Senior Business Manager chez Quanteam

J’ai choisi de rejoindre le cabinet en 2020 et je suis très heureux d’y occuper un poste complet au sein d’une entreprise humaine, qui favorise la montée en compétences et qui sait reconnaitre le travail accompli. Il y a une vraie émulsion entre les équipes ainsi qu’une bonne ambiance qu’on retrouve au quotidien ou lors des afterworks et des évènements du cabinet. La proximité que nous entretenons soigneusement avec nos clients ainsi que nos consultants est à l’image de celle qui existe en interne avec les équipes et avec la direction. Plus que tout, j’ai le sentiment que le travail est reconnu à sa juste valeur et qu’il a un impact direct sur l’évolution de carrière.

J’ai toujours eu des missions géniales chez QUANTEAM

François, Consultant Manager – Practice Finance Quantitative

Ingénieur de formation, j’ai rejoint les équipes de Quanteam il y a plus de 10 ans, après une expérience mitigée dans un cabinet de conseil concurrent. C’est la mission proposée qui m’a attiré en premier lieu (support pre-trade en salle de marché) , mais ce sont les valeurs humaines et l’accompagnement dont fait preuve le cabinet qui m’a fait rester. J’ai toujours eu des missions géniales chez Quanteam. J’ai pu rejoidre le bureau de Londres, pendant plusieurs mois, et j’ai évolué grâce aux nombreuses opportunités de postes internes. Quanteam est très bien référencé chez nos clients et le cabinet propose de belles missions, avec de beaux challenges techniques et fonctionnels. Pour ceux qui attendent plus qu’une simple mission de la part d’un cabinet, Quanteam est l’endroit idéal.

De belles missions dans le secteur Bancaire et une proximité dès les premiers échanges

Ghaoutia, Consultante Manager – Practice Transformation et Organisation

Après un passage au sein de plusieurs cabinets de conseil et ESN, essentiellement sur des missions de chefferie / direction de Projets MOA, j’ai rejoint Quanteam en 2021. J’avais une très belle proposition côté éditeur, mais j’ai rapidement senti un feeling humain et une sensation de bienveillance lors de mes premiers échanges avec Quanteam, qui ont fait la différence et qui m’ont convaincue de rejoindre le cabinet. La qualité et la diversité des missions proposées dans le secteur Bancaire, domaine de prédilection du cabinet, étaient également un atout non négligeable pour moi. J’ai d’ailleurs pu réaliser deux belles missions (direction de projets et de conseil) et j’ai pu coacher des consultants en amont de leurs entretiens de missions. Deux ans après, je ne regrette pas mon choix. Je retrouve cette proximité et cette volonté de collaborer, au quotidien, notamment avec l’équipe commerciale mais également au sein des équipes projets.

Chacun peut trouver sa place et évoluer

Marc, Chef de projet MOA chez Quanteam / co-directeur de la Practice Operations & Finance

Je suis consultant depuis plus de 20 ans, au sein de différentes Banques et Assurances. J’ai rejoint le bureau parisien de Quanteam il y a 7 ans car j’ai apprécié les valeurs humaines lors des premières rencontres, valeurs que je partage au quotidien. La direction reste également très accessible et transparente dans ses échanges avec les collaborateurs du cabinet, comme ce fut le cas lors de la période COVID. Ce qui est d’autant plus appréciable que ce n’a pas été le cas partout. Enfin, les missions proposées diversifiées et variées permettent à chacun et chacune de s’enrichir professionnellement et personnellement.

La liberté de choisir ses missions est très appréciable

Mathieu, Consultant Manager – Practice Transformation et Organisation

J’ai rejoint Quanteam en 2019, après plusieurs expériences dans le conseil, en tant qu’Analyste Equity Derivatives, puis comme Chef de Projets IT. J’occupe aujourd’hui un rôle de Scrum Master / BA au sein d’une équipe anti-fraude. Ce qui me plaît chez Quanteam, c’est la richesse et la diversité des missions proposées, et la forte implantation du cabinet sur les secteurs bancaires et financiers. Le cabinet écoute les souhaits de ses consultants et leurs donne le choix des missions, ce qui n’est pas le cas partout. En termes d’évolution, j’ai souhaité intégrer la Practice Transformation et Organisation afin d’acquérir de nouvelles compétences, grâce aux experts qui la compose. J’ai réalisé plusieurs formations certifiantes, ce qui me donne vraiment l’impression que le cabinet investi sur moi.

La satisfaction d’être reconnu pour son travail et d’évoluer dans une bonne ambiance

Geoffroy, Consultant Expert – Practice Finance Quantitative

Après des études en Ingénierie et un Master de Recherche en Nanotechnologie, j’ai travaillé dans les secteurs de l’Energie et du Retail, au sein de cabinets de conseil / ESN du Big Four. Puis j’ai rejoint Quanteam, en 2018, en tant que Développeur Full Stack sur des problématiques de produits structurés et produits exotiques au sein d’une grande banque française. Dès le début, j’ai senti le soutien du cabinet dans l’accompagnement de ses consultants, via la formation. Grâce à Quanteam, j’ai d’ailleurs pu renforcer mes compétences à travers un Master en Finance Quantitative, en cours du soir, qui m’a permis d’intégrer la Practice Quant et de conjuguer mes compétences techniques à ma compréhension des problématiques Métiers, Business et Fonctionnelles.

Il y a une vraie émulsion entre les équipes ainsi qu’une bonne ambiance qu’on retrouve au quotidien ou lors des afterworks et des évènements du cabinet. Plus que tout, j’ai le sentiment que le travail est reconnu à sa juste valeur et qu’il a un impact direct sur l’évolution de carrière.
